commit_message:
Delete secret key on image deletion

We add two extra properties for images:
- cinder_encryption_key_id, which stores the encryption key id;
- cinder_encryption_key_deletion_policy, which states whether the secret
  key should be deleted on image deletion.

This feature uses the Castellan key manager, and will therefore work
with all its supported backends.

Implements: blueprint barbican-secret-deletion-support
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iacd0b3785ad4cdd06961e6d11967775806e009ff

The HPE Lefthand driver has failed to demonstrate Pyton3.7
support as was required during the Train release.  As

commit_message:
Mark HPE Lefthand Driver Unsupported

The HPE Lefthand driver has failed to demonstrate Pyton3.7
support as was required during the Train release.  As
a result the driver is being marked unsupported and will
be removed in the 'U' release if support is not
demonstrated via 3rd Party CI.

Change-Id: Ib495dc5931f8011cbc8b7527dec419d143fca1d5

subject: k8s: fix flannel network configuration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 20498, 'name': 'Spyros Trigazis', 'email': 'strigazi@gmail.com', 'username': 'strigazi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-06-28 12:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2019-07-25 18:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-07-29 03:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi mnaser, so is this a regression issue introduced by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/597150/7/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/flannel-service.sh ? and I think it's only impacting when the node is being restarted, right?"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:42:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

No, it always doesn't work, because by default the iptables rule is set to DROP."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-07-30 03:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM, but as I mentioned in other patches, it would be nice to decouple this with others.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-07-30 03:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Tested again. In my testing, even without this patch. I can still ping a pod running on another node. Would you mind letting me know how to reproduce your issue? Maybe I missed something. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-01 09:27:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

For us it works without it since months.

One of thre reasons we moved to cni is things like this.

Are you sure it is not working without this iptable rule?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-08-02 14:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://github.com/coreos/flannel/issues/799'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-05 06:46:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I have commented on this since some time. The issue was happening on node reboot. https://github.com/coreos/flannel/issues/799#issuecomment-440280752

But since we moved flannel to the a daemonset I don't see this anymore.

How can I reproduce? For me on reboot of nodes, flannel continues to work just fine."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-05 06:47:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If the issue persists, this patch won't work. This script runs only on one master node."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-08-24 08:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As for the conformance testing against flannel, I tested 3 times today. 
1) With master branch
2) With only https://review.opendev.org/668074
3) With https://review.opendev.org/668074 and this patch

All of them failed with the same test cases(10 cases [1]). So I think at least this patch is not related to the conformance test failure.

@Spyros, do you have any idea about the conformance test failure againt flannel?

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/763160/'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-28 11:48:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I got the DNS tested to pass with vxlan. Without this change. I'm running the full conformance suite now.

The default backend is and shouldn't be used in production udp. With udp it fails.

Not production users (or anyone) shouldn't offer udp.

The only change I had to do in master is https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678067/ . The one for the network name for the cloud-provider.

I don't know if udp can work for new versions of k8s. We can switch the default to vxlan. It is the default because this is an open source project, so history."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-08-28 15:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So all tests are passing, the only required change was https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678067/


Aug 28 13:49:03.598: INFO: Running AfterSuite actions on node 1
Aug 28 13:49:03.598: INFO: Skipping dumping logs from cluster

Ran 204 of 3585 Specs in 5583.638 seconds
SUCCESS! -- 204 Passed | 0 Failed | 0 Pending | 3381 Skipped PASS

Ginkgo ran 1 suite in 1h33m4.935775345s
Test Suite Passed'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-05 13:49:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shouldn't we update the default to vxlan then?  It's defaulting to udp and as a user, that's a bad experience."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-09-05 22:06:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have changed it, see https://review.opendev.org/679587'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-06 13:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

superseeded by 679587'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-28 12:36:16.000000000', 'message': 'k8s: fix flannel network configuration

Flannel has been broken since it was moved to self hosted.  The
iptables rules necessary to be there were removed in that commit
and therefore it was always failing to provision any flannel
clusters.

Change-Id: I5d8ef0ed187a6af854d1412f8dad5d634750655e
'}]
commit_message:
k8s: fix flannel network configuration

Flannel has been broken since it was moved to self hosted.  The
iptables rules necessary to be there were removed in that commit
and therefore it was always failing to provision any flannel
clusters.

Change-Id: I5d8ef0ed187a6af854d1412f8dad5d634750655e

commit_message:
openstack-macros: Use py3 in %openstack_test_package_install

We want to switch all packages to python3, so the macro for the test
package installation needs to link into python3.

Change-Id: Ia2086ad040a96b86e46d8435346875adecac8e3a

commit_message:
Improve workflow notifications and webhook data

The task_execution_id is required to be able to restore the hierarchy
of tasks and workflows on the notification receiver side. Also, including
the event in the notification is very useful.

Also fix the documentation as multiline strings are not supported in
ini files.

Change-Id: I714fd5c32b0f31f85ac5a4d22d161e662bf18687

commit_message:
metal: add docs + start using no_containers

We have a feature that allows us to stop using containers for
a specific host inside the openstack_user_config directly.

This patch starts making the metal jobs to use it instead of
using an env.d override which should make the upgrade jobs much
cleaner.

Change-Id: I1b2116b86d1e4d68867111068aaf2d32e7f3a731

Thank you for review, yes these stores are filesystem stores only.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Question inline.  Also, I think it might be worth specifically stating that the scope of this is to use *only* filesystem stores for this purpose.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-02-21 08:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Question inline.  Also, I think it might be worth specifically

 > for this purpose.

It can be done the way you have suggested as well, but then I need to make changes to glance-store as well for registering these new groups and options for these groups. If other people suggests this way we should proceed then no issues for me as well :D'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-02-22 17:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Question inline.  Also, I think it might be worth specifically
 > > stating that the scope of this is to use *only* filesystem stores
 > > for this purpose.
 > 
 > It can be done the way you have suggested as well, but then I need
 > to make changes to glance-store as well for registering these new
 > groups and options for these groups. If other people suggests this
 > way we should proceed then no issues for me as well :D

I think we should document that file store is currently only supported backend for this, yet the plan is not to rule out possibility to utilize for example rbd for it.

As the multiple back-ends will stay experimental in Stein we should not look into merging these changes yet but push it all together in Train.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I like this version, thanks Abhishek!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-27 22:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

One final question: How are we going to handle the current node_staging_uri and [tasks]/work_dir options?  We need to deprecate them obviously, but if they are there, do we auto populate the appropriate filesystem_store_datadir setting for the os_glance_*_store config?'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-02-28 05:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-02-28 05:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > One final question: How are we going to handle the current
 > node_staging_uri and [tasks]/work_dir options?  We need to
 > deprecate them obviously, but if they are there, do we auto
 > populate the appropriate filesystem_store_datadir setting for the
 > os_glance_*_store config?

Hi Brian,

These reserved stores will be injected only if *multiple backends            are enabled* i.e. enabled_backends config option is defined in            glance-api.conf. If multiple backend is not enabled then            node_staging_uri and work_dir config options will work as it is.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-02-28 05:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1

Moved to Train'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-14 06:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-24 21:31:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Needs a slight update for Train.  (See inline comments.)  But also, now we are in Train where multi-store support is for real.  Is the default config going to use multi-store with just one store defined?  That would impact whether we could use node_staging_uri and [tasks]/work_dir to automatically populate the os_glance_staging_store and os_glance_tasks_store ... what's the current thinking on that?"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-29 05:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Published edit on patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-05-29 05:32:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Fix sensitivity to the initial device driver

Previously it was expected that all devices are initially
binded on kernel driver. In case of userspace driver it
caused an incorrect behavior.

This patch makes sriov binding driver insensitive for
initial device driver.

Change-Id: I1be19aceb9176d1bdf7f0f712a4a02ec2cd3ce8d
Closes-Bug: 1842446
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

Use releasenotes/notes/pike-metadefs-changes-95b54e0bf8bbefd6.yaml as a model.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 26233, 'date': '2019-03-28 02:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-03-28 13:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

sure ill add a release not but im not sure how long the nova side will take to merge but im hoping it will be quick.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-03-28 13:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-01 20:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

By the time you get back to this, there should already be a releasenote in the repo that you can update: releasenotes/notes/train-metadefs-changes-c4380754cdd13a19.yaml'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-07 18:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-08 02:45:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This looks good.  Please also update the enumeration in doc/source/admin/useful-image-properties.rst -- it would be helpful if you say something about the 'none' value, specifically under what circumstances you'd want to use it (is there a difference between hw_video_model: none and not having the hw_video_model property on an image at all?)"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-08 22:29:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> This looks good.  Please also update the enumeration in
 > doc/source/admin/useful-image-properties.rst -- it would be helpful
 > if you say something about the 'none' value, specifically under
 > what circumstances you'd want to use it (is there a difference
 > between hw_video_model: none and not having the hw_video_model
 > property on an image at all?)

yes there is

if you don't set it at all the we use a default based on your hypervisor 

if hw_video_model=none then we will not allocate a virtual graphics device. you use this if you are using gpu pasthough to ensure the only graphics device that is exposted to the guest is the passthrough gpu.

ill update the description to reflect that."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-21 00:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-09-06 02:33:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM.  Thanks, Sean.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-09-06 11:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
add metadef vlaues for new video models

- This change adds the newly supported libvirt
  video models, virtio, gop and none.
- This change updates the train metadefs changes
  release note.

Change-Id: I440a038b53825b5f92fc977566edcf3cabfba673

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I83f264f58543ae90a941afd37567eeb46b4acfcc
'}]
commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I83f264f58543ae90a941afd37567eeb46b4acfcc

[{'created': '2019-07-04 07:30:32.000000000', 'message': 'Send global_request_id for tracing calls

This patch adds the global_request_id to the constructor for nova client,
keystone client, neutron client and placement client which will pass the
global_request_id into these respective services on all API calls.
Supporting global_request_id makes debugging easier when request touches
many services in cloud. The blazar global_request-id will be sent to
these services in the request header like below and it will be available
with context.global_request_id:

which logs global request ID `req-e19f8f4f-40e7-441e-b776-7b43ed15c7dd`
is shown below.

commit_message:
Send global_request_id for tracing calls

This patch adds global_request_id to the constructor for nova client,
keystone client, neutron client and placement client which will pass the
global_request_id to these respective services on all API calls.
Supporting global_request_id makes debugging easier when requests reach
many different OpenStack services. The blazar global_request_id will be
sent to these services in the request header like below and it will be
available with context.global_request_id:

  -H "X-OpenStack-Request-ID: req-1a9b7b24-02ed-4400-bcc3-cc1bcbb59147"

Sample log output of neutron service for ``POST v1/floatingips`` API
which logs global request ID `req-e19f8f4f-40e7-441e-b776-7b43ed15c7dd`
is shown at: http://paste.openstack.org/show/753807

Oslo spec I65de8261746b25d45e105394f4eeb95b9cb3bd42
Change-Id: I5bb3631c4fb178293ee8eefbe1aa8b819a196a9f

commit_message:
ML2 plugin: extract and postpone limit in port query

as with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656066/ if limit is applied in
any place other than at the end of the filters, sql alchemy will return
an error, and possibily we could return less result than intended.

Change-Id: I9a54ae99d2d5dfda63cb0061bcf3d727ed7cc992
Closes-Bug: #1827363

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I5f2caba62595946f8ade6db22a1aba080b927fc8

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iddd52c58c0ce33dc39e5746a0dfce2f900cea6b6

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: If9126950cdd8c386df8f7c3b8b88ce22b47fe133
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2019-09-04 09:07:12.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure conflicts creating subnet from subnetpools are retried

If a lot of subnets are created at once, there is a chance that
Neutron will get the calls concurrently and fail. Internally Neutron
will retry but it may happen that the limit in the number of retries
is also hit. Thus this patch ensures that scenario is catched and
reacted to.

Change-Id: I83d62616835f22e916bfe056e793eb31654be51f
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure conflicts creating subnet from subnetpools are retried

If a lot of subnets are created at once, there is a chance that
Neutron will get the calls concurrently and fail. Internally Neutron
will retry but it may happen that the limit in the number of retries
is also hit. Thus this patch ensures that scenario is catched and
reacted to.

Change-Id: I83d62616835f22e916bfe056e793eb31654be51f

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Iebca5c4cc8dfdecf7c561b3612691b62ca4ac0c8

commit_message:
opensuse: use proper nodeset

Also convert to the right set of packages and sort
the list alphabetically: High level changes are:

- switch to python 3.x
- switch to mkisofs, genisoimage was dropped

Change-Id: I17d36a2d36c941c5b5e3b5a40e42315caf275da4

(1 comment)

Thanks for doing this! A more general question - we are using Fluentd 1.4.2 because that is the most recent version packaged in the TD repo? I see they have released Fluent 1.6.3 (https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md), but also that 1.0.0 is considered the current stable version (https://www.fluentd.org/download). Should we pin to the latest stable version?'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-13 09:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thanks for doing this! A more general question - we are using
 > Fluentd 1.4.2 because that is the most recent version packaged in
 > the TD repo? I see they have released Fluent 1.6.3
 > (https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md), but
 > also that 1.0.0 is considered the current stable version
 > (https://www.fluentd.org/download). Should we pin to the latest
 > stable version?

Yeah, we are more or less limited with what is in the TD repo - http://packages.treasure-data.com. When CentOS 8 will be released, I hope we can get newer packages from CentOS ops tools repo and can use that - but for the time being TD repo is the only sensible option.

We can pin the version, but then somebody needs to manage it... Unless we find a viable solution for maintaining those ,,pins'' - like one constraints file and a checking mechanism - I don't think that's the best idea."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-13 09:34:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Thanks for doing this! A more general question - we are using
 > > Fluentd 1.4.2 because that is the most recent version packaged in
 > > the TD repo? I see they have released Fluent 1.6.3
 > > (https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md), but
 > > also that 1.0.0 is considered the current stable version
 > > (https://www.fluentd.org/download). Should we pin to the latest
 > > stable version?
 > 
 > Yeah, we are more or less limited with what is in the TD repo -
 > http://packages.treasure-data.com. When CentOS 8 will be released,
 > I hope we can get newer packages from CentOS ops tools repo and can
 > use that - but for the time being TD repo is the only sensible
 > option.
 > 
 > We can pin the version, but then somebody needs to manage it...
 > Unless we find a viable solution for maintaining those ,,pins'' -
 > like one constraints file and a checking mechanism - I don't think
 > that's the best idea.

And still fluentd.org/download webpage directs users to fluentd v.1.0 (I think they mean 1.0 series) td-agent 3.4.1 - which is the latest one in TD repo."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-13 09:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-13 10:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

Ok, I think that makes sense. According to [1] td-agent 3.4.1 is latest stable, and that's what we get from the TD repo, so we are upgrading to the latest stable version. That sounds good to me.

The downside of not-pinning is that we might get surprise upgrades which don't work with the existing Fluentd config. I agree that it's a pain to keep bumping them (we already have this situation for many other images). Personally I prefer not having the risk of a surprise upgrade, but will leave that for others to decide. Apart from that this looks good to me, although will wait for the KA change.

[1] https://support.treasuredata.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001479187-The-td-agent-ChangeLog"}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-13 13:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-13 18:28:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-09 12:35:17.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Bump up fluentd

Change-Id: I40a81103317ac044d9311b2505593056cf313bd2
'}, {'created': '2019-08-09 17:04:28.000000000', 'message': 'Change fluentd to td-agent on CentOS

Fluentd packages in CentOS Opstools SIG repos is very old,
because of old-ish ruby (2.0) packaged with CentOS 7.

On the other hand - TreasureData packages for fluentd are packaged
with embedded ruby as dependencies - so this change moves to those.
Thanks to that we are able to move from fluentd 0.12 to 1.4.2.

Still we need ruby-devel, because we download monasca output plugin
as source and build them during installation.

Change-Id: I40a81103317ac044d9311b2505593056cf313bd2

Fluentd/TD-Agent per arch/distro status after this change:
x86_64:
  centos: package from td-agent repo, with ruby embedded and
          elasticsearch plugin embedded
  ubuntu/debian: td-agent repo, with ruby embedded and
                 elasticsearch plugin embedded
arm:
  centos: CentOS opstools repo with backlevel ruby and old fluentd,
          plugins packaged as rpms
  ubuntu/debian: fluentd & plugins installed using gem

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676131

'}, {'created': '2019-08-27 07:58:58.000000000', 'message': 'Change fluentd to td-agent on CentOS

Fluentd packages in CentOS Opstools SIG repos is very old,
because of old-ish ruby (2.0) packaged with CentOS 7.

On the other hand - TreasureData packages for fluentd are packaged
with embedded ruby as dependencies - so this change moves to those.

Still we need ruby-devel, because we download monasca output plugin
as source and build them during installation.

commit_message:
Change fluentd to td-agent on CentOS

Fluentd packages in CentOS Opstools SIG repos is very old,
because of old-ish ruby (2.0) packaged with CentOS 7.

On the other hand - TreasureData packages for fluentd are packaged
with embedded ruby as dependencies - so this change moves to those.
Thanks to that we are able to move from fluentd 0.12 to 1.4.2.

Still we need ruby-devel for non-td-agent distros,
because we download monasca output plugin as source and build it
during installation.

* Bump up td.repo to version 3
* Merge sudoers into one file
* Change fluentd plugin install macro to reflect changes

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679209/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679885/
Change-Id: I40a81103317ac044d9311b2505593056cf313bd2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 16:30:03.000000000', 'message': 'Stop deleting random things from /usr/share

We have an application breaking because /usr/share/cracklib is being
deleted from wiped out from the image. The application installs its
dependencies, including cracklib, but since yum shows that cracklib
is already installed, it does not reinstall it. But since random files
are being deleted, things are broken.

I think this is an attempt at image minimization, which is a
reasonable goal, but such aggressive attempts at minimization should
be undertaken in a separate element, or done more cleanly (maybe
by uninstalling the package if possible, or other means.)

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09
'}, {'created': '2019-08-16 16:31:24.000000000', 'message': 'Stop deleting random things from /usr/share

We have an application breaking because /usr/share/cracklib is being
deleted from the image. The application installs its dependencies,
including cracklib, but since yum shows that cracklib is already
installed, it does not reinstall it. But since random files are being
deleted, things are broken.

I think this is an attempt at image minimization, which is a
reasonable goal, but such aggressive attempts at minimization should
be undertaken in a separate element, or done more cleanly (maybe
by uninstalling the package if possible, or other means.)

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09
'}, {'created': '2019-08-30 13:19:42.000000000', 'message': 'Do not delete cracklib from /usr/share

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09
'}]
commit_message:
Do not delete cracklib from /usr/share

We have an application breaking because /usr/share/cracklib is being
deleted from the image. The application installs its dependencies,
including cracklib, but since yum shows that cracklib is already
installed, it does not reinstall it.

Change-Id: Id6fccf76c706dbc6c2124abcfd12c1f10cef5e09

'}, {'created': '2019-09-05 06:10:59.000000000', 'message': 'Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: If5446ce4ceee7e38a0052503aa8fc2b6c5d7de66

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Ib7379bb5066ede1956424dc92cf302ec22053f21

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 23:52:39.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3d1a821a952fa8658372195d8737e0cce97b24e9
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3d1a821a952fa8658372195d8737e0cce97b24e9

commit_message:
Create placement client for each request

In plugin files to talk to placement, we created one client and reused
it, but it turned out that to support global-request-id we'd like to
prepare fresh client with current context.

Therefore this patch prepares for it using fresh client in all API
methods of get, post, put and delete.

Change-Id: Iaa66019d6bc376d07f4f4a703f3dcfc6619eb358
Partially-Implements: blueprint oslo-middleware-request-id

commit_message:
Move descriptions of openstack_auth settings

This commit moves descriptions of settings defined in openstack_auth
from openstack_dashboard/settings.py and local_settings.py
to openstack_auth/settings.py.

When openstack_dashboard has different default settings
from openstack_auth defaults, they are now moved to
openstack_dashboard/defaults.py.

Part of blueprint ini-based-configuration
Change-Id: Ie201c78ddb26bdfcbc6f54c62be2561e4834e3d6

commit_message:
Fixed use of flake8

Flake8 was wrongly listed as a runtime dependency. That mistake messed
system flake8 version. Flake8 is a test requirement not a runtime one.

Also flake8 version is already determined by hacking version, so we
update it to recent version.

Change-Id: Iccd9dc6f2508127f17712d16dfce6538ff83807e

commit_message:
Allow configurable gzip binary name

Add a new environment variable $DIB_GZIP_BIN allowing builders to
specify a different gzip (such as pigz) to be used when compressing
tgz images.

Change-Id: Ifb617568140a149e2fda241e07ff8a59429e6697

[{'created': '2019-08-14 10:04:28.000000000', 'message': 'Firewall creation failed due to "INACTIVE"

Create firewall by heat with template file unsuccessfully due to
"INACTIVE".But I can create firewall successfully In the state of
INACTIVE via the rest api of neutron. And the status INACTIVE to
firewall is that the firewall is not applied to a router.And it
can still work in INACTIVE status. So we can judge the firewall
is created successfully in inactive state.

Change-Id: I6c329808b1a0b27a5a6e834de41fa9944739b9a0
'}, {'created': '2019-08-16 06:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'Firewall creation failed due to "INACTIVE"

Create firewall by heat with template file unsuccessfully due to
"INACTIVE".But I can create firewall successfully In the state of
INACTIVE via the rest api of neutron. And the status INACTIVE to
firewall is that the firewall is not applied to a router.And it
can still work in INACTIVE status. So we can judge the firewall
is created successfully in inactive state.

Change-Id: I6c329808b1a0b27a5a6e834de41fa9944739b9a0
Story: #2006351
Task: #36117
'}]
commit_message:
Firewall creation failed due to "INACTIVE"

Create firewall by heat with template file unsuccessfully due to
"INACTIVE".But I can create firewall successfully In the state of
INACTIVE via the rest api of neutron. And the status INACTIVE to
firewall is that the firewall is not applied to a router.And it
can still work in INACTIVE status. So we can judge the firewall
is created successfully in inactive state.

Change-Id: I6c329808b1a0b27a5a6e834de41fa9944739b9a0
Story: #2006351
Task: #36117

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 13:04:25.000000000', 'message': "Remove runtime.LockOSThread() call from kuryr-cni

runtime.LockOSThread() was a leftover from initial CNI plugin skeleton.
It is only required when CNI plugin does the netns operations. Our
plugin isn't doing that as it's kuryr-daemon that is responsible for
that.

Also the imports are now in nicer order.

Change-Id: I1d7ee6a8fec104fd09094a49304a4c22b419cf3a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove runtime.LockOSThread() call from kuryr-cni

runtime.LockOSThread() was a leftover from initial CNI plugin skeleton.
It is only required when CNI plugin does the netns operations. Our
plugin isn't doing that as it's kuryr-daemon that is responsible for
that.

Also the imports are now in nicer order.

Change-Id: I1d7ee6a8fec104fd09094a49304a4c22b419cf3a

Remove exit_on_stop from Watcher

We don't need exit_on_stop option now as we always set it to True. This
commit removes it to simplify the code.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 21:45:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If5baea647e6a31158b87b070d56e529d29370a94
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If5baea647e6a31158b87b070d56e529d29370a94

subject: Use shutil.move rather than os.rename
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-09-05 19:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-09-06 08:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 19:17:13.000000000', 'message': 'Use shutil.move rather than os.rename

When the source and destination file paths are not on the same partition
os.rename raises OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link.

Use shutil.move instead.

Change-Id: I28d6cb6c15a4496243fab7ec6c7eedcd1422f4c2
Closes-Bug: #1833804
'}]
commit_message:
Use shutil.move rather than os.rename

When the source and destination file paths are not on the same partition
os.rename raises OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link.

Use shutil.move instead.

Change-Id: I28d6cb6c15a4496243fab7ec6c7eedcd1422f4c2
Closes-Bug: #1833804

commit_message:
Drop python-distilclient

Not sure if there is interest in Distil and the client is in the x/
namespace . I suggest to remove it and if there is some need, we can
restore from git history.

Change-Id: I478e383c916a4e9c37e06cedd62f2631d51512e1

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I5845b56352e5e253c847a3829e60d57ef60b0289
Sem-Ver: feature

Strange, maybe it got deleted?'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2019-09-06 06:17:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Ifccf58c1cfbc7527fc49f3083af23b3d063495a4
Story: #2005924

commit_message:
Removing leftovers from subnet Port Groups

This patch is removing a method which was written to insert
ACLs to allow DHCP traffic. See change [0] and related bug
for details.

[0] I30bee5c5576554b162e66e1b5dfbe734522ab363

Change-Id: I46bde139f8ee836b4b8ecf10de3fc29403505e4d
Related-Bug: #1790900
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 07:30:53.000000000', 'message': "Add request_id middleware support

'x-openstack-request-id' is the common header name for request ID
which is implemented in most of the OpenStack services. Using the
oslo middleware `request_id` middleware is a convenient way to
generate request ID and also include it in the response.

The request ID will be generated by the oslo middleware and is
inserted into the request environment. On the response end, the
middleware is again used, this time to attach the
'x-openstack-request-id' header, using the value of the generated
request ID.

Note: For v2 apis, the request_id is not returned in response header
but it will be logged in logs.

APIImpact:
responses of the API will include 'x-openstack-request-id' header.

Implements: blueprint oslo-middleware-request-id

Change-Id: I437f783787514ff1add2d7f0059cb27addd12c3e

commit_message:
Add request_id middleware support

'x-openstack-request-id' is the common header name for request ID
which is implemented in most of the OpenStack services. Using the
oslo middleware `request_id` middleware is a convenient way to
generate request ID and also include it in the response.

The request ID will be generated by the oslo middleware and is
inserted into the request environment. On the response end, the
middleware is again used, this time to attach the
'x-openstack-request-id' header, using the value of the generated
request ID.

Sample log output of blazar-api service for ``GET v1/os-hosts`` API
which logs local request ID `req-de45521c-2a04-4e7d-809a-960e782eb1e7`
is shown below:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/753805/

Note: For v2 apis, the request_id is not returned in response header
but it will be logged in logs.

APIImpact:
responses of the API will include 'x-openstack-request-id' header.

Implements: blueprint oslo-middleware-request-id
Change-Id: I437f783787514ff1add2d7f0059cb27addd12c3e

commit_message:
Update for Storyboard

This project uses storyboard for new bugs, so fix a few places:

* Fix the "Report a bug" links so that bugs get reported against
  storyboard, not launchpad.
* Update CONTRIBUTING to link to storyboard.

Change-Id: I2760db2e14015407af46ec52ffe4883262ccb5ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 13:09:54.000000000', 'message': "tempest: Cleanup & fixes

- Add a systemd tmpfile to create /run/tempest which can be used
  during testruns
- Split python3-tempest subpackage to have the python module in an
  extra package (similar to other openstack services)
- generate and install /etc/tempest/tempest.conf . It's always useful
  to have a sample config file available
- create /var/lib/openstack-tempest-test on (open)SUSE systems to be
  compatible with older tempest packages from SUSE
- Add Provides/Obsoletes for openstack-tempest-test package
  on (open)SUSE to be compatible with older tempest packages

Change-Id: Ib791fa19cac43fe2a72bd86d599d6a6343ec50b6
"}, {'created': '2019-09-05 14:34:12.000000000', 'message': "tempest: Cleanup & fixes

- Split python3-tempest subpackage to have the python module in an

- generate and install /etc/tempest/tempest.conf . It's always useful
  to have a sample config file available
- create /var/lib/openstack-tempest-test on (open)SUSE systems to be
  compatible with older tempest packages from SUSE

Change-Id: Ib791fa19cac43fe2a72bd86d599d6a6343ec50b6

commit_message:
tempest: Cleanup & fixes

- Add a systemd tmpfile to create /run/tempest which can be used
  during testruns
- Split python3-tempest subpackage to have the python module in an
  extra package (similar to other openstack services)
- generate and install /etc/tempest/tempest.conf . It's always useful
  to have a sample config file available
- create /var/lib/openstack-tempest-test on (open)SUSE systems to be
  compatible with older tempest packages from SUSE
- Add Provides/Obsoletes for openstack-tempest-test package
  on (open)SUSE to be compatible with older tempest packages

Change-Id: Ib791fa19cac43fe2a72bd86d599d6a6343ec50b6

commit_message:
Rename openSUSE 15.1 testing to 15

This is consistent with the previous simplication of
build targets in the opendev environment to refer to
"opensuse15" being the alias of "latest stable openSUSE Leap 15.x".

Change-Id: I904a3ca0d6dbddd2bb1a673836ab6a0ad249526d

[{'account_id': 30456, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:23:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30456, 'date': '2019-09-06 06:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30456, 'date': '2019-09-06 06:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
New command "openstack overcloud node unprovision"

This is a companion command to "openstack overcloud node provision"
which is required for scale-down and should be run after "openstack
overcloud deploy".

It will undeploy any instance which has provisioned=False in the
supplied roles yaml, see this change[1] for the provisioned format.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672605/

Change-Id: Ic7705c290220df7c55656fa080ff74315fb2030f
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672848/

commit_message:
Add multistack support to tripleo-ansible-inventory

If tripleo-ansible-inventory is called with '--stack foo,bar',
then build an inventory for stack foo and stack bar; then
merge the two inventories into one before writing it out to
an inventory file.

An ansible inventory host group will be created for every
item in the cross product of stacks and roles. For example,
central_Controller, edge0_Compute, edge1_Compute, etc.

Change-Id: I23fdeaa4950244bf3aec8e8ea71e8a29f763c074
Depends-On: I522f1acbd39ad36ae1fec896188d3e20e0575566
Implements: blueprint split-control-plane-unified-inventory

[{'created': '2019-09-04 01:10:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add empty block for "fluentd_monasca_plugin_install"

This change will add an empty block for `fluentd_monasca_plugin_install` to
ensure there are no plugins installed. In a proposed change in kolla, a new
block is being added specifically for the monasca plugins, which is causing
our container build process to fail in their external CI. By blocking this
out we'll maintain our expected stance of not installing any plugins.

Change-Id: Ic7f2d12073883bce4e03a48ff6a2515acf6298bf
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/675614
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add empty block for "fluentd_monasca_plugin_install"

This change will add an empty block for `fluentd_monasca_plugin_install` to
ensure there are no plugins installed. In a proposed change in kolla, a new
block is being added specifically for the monasca plugins, which is causing
our container build process to fail in their external CI. By blocking this
out we'll maintain our expected stance of not installing any plugins.

Change-Id: Ic7f2d12073883bce4e03a48ff6a2515acf6298bf
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/675614
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

We can't have numbers starting an Ansible var, so we need to rename the
pre/post deployments host vars, or we hit this error:
  template error while templating string: expected token 'end of print statement'

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_variables.html#creating-valid-variable-names

In this patch we have to duplicate host vars but it'll be cleaned up
once we change to the new file in THT.

Change-Id: Idbdd6a21eb2cd488daa1e3ddc844b4fc5267047c
Related-Bug: #1842141
"}]
commit_message:
config-download: rename pre/post deployment hostvars

We can't have numbers starting an Ansible var, so we need to rename the
pre/post deployments host vars, or we hit this error:
  template error while templating string: expected token 'end of print statement'

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_variables.html#creating-valid-variable-names

In this patch we have to duplicate host vars but it'll be cleaned up
once we change to the new file in THT.

Change-Id: Idbdd6a21eb2cd488daa1e3ddc844b4fc5267047c
Related-Bug: #1842141

commit_message:
Use undercloud-connection to local for running validations with the CLI

This patch adds the **undercloud_connection** (set to 'ssh' by default)
parameter to the get_tripleo_ansible_inventory() function which allow
the CLI to create a static inventory file with local connection for the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I50d486afe2a11e830c72145154dc2b0764aece07
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5075a76366db0923f12fd515144078658fdd9a77)

commit_message:
Make periodic job run with check parameters

In tripleo-ci we mix periodic jobs with promotion jobs.
This patch makes periodic jobs to run periodically, but with
settings of regular "check" job (instead of "promotion" job)
Change-Id: I534c47b62ae6aa316ec1dc19bec878924143e015

commit_message:
PDF Documentation Build tox target

This patch adds a `pdf-docs` tox target that will build
PDF versions of our docs. As per the Train community goal:

  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

This repo was not setup for building docs at all, so:
* enables the docs job and fixes tox.ini for it.
* add doc/requirements.txt and use in tox.ini
* update doc/source/conf.py for using openstackdocstheme

Note that the documents are just skeletons, so we do not publish the
docs yet, just build them.

Also, cleans up .zuul.yaml and uses templates where possible instead of
individual jobs.

Story: 2006122
Task: 35513
Change-Id: I89db230c31464a89a82aa72b86348f51b61990ca

commit_message:
Introduce TripleoInventories object

This object can be constructed by passing it
a mapping of stack name to TripleoInventory
objects.

It has a merge method which merges all of the
TripleoInventory objects into one OrderedDict
which appends the stack name and an underscore
to each host group to avoid name collisions.

It has a write_static_inventory method which
writes the merged OrderedDict into an Ansible
inventory.

Change-Id: I522f1acbd39ad36ae1fec896188d3e20e0575566
Implements: blueprint split-control-plane-unified-inventory

commit_message:
Fix OVS build issue on Fedora

No longer build the OVS kernel modules when installing from
source. This was added when OVS didn't support conntrack,
which hasn't been the case for a while.

Change-Id: I446697c9073a43cdc609bba47357a3bd960ef56d

Why is this needed?'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:01:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why is this needed?

This doesn't seem needed after the change in volume manager to handle the 'encrypted' flag if not returned by the driver[1], but doesn't harm to add  it along with more testing.
Anyways keeping/discarding this patch is fine with me.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/193673/4/cinder/volume/manager.py"}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-09-05 17:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 28403, 'date': '2019-09-06 05:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Thank you for your review, Rajat Dhasmana and Eric Harney.
Let me reconsider in the next version.'}]

commit_message:
NEC Driver: return encrypted parameter

This patch adds encrypted to the connector object.

Change-Id: I9e5522abcd61d40190c9f5a9d17ec60d065889f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 12:43:51.000000000', 'message': "Google Cloud Storage connection failure: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'encode'

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods and the type of the return value was based on the specific encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a decode() method which can only be used with codecs that produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735

commit_message:
Google backup: correct string encoding between py 2 and 3

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode
string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods
and the type of the return value was based on the specific
encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and
that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes
objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a
decode() method which can only be used with codecs that
produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735

commit_message:
Resolve multiple warnings

install-deps: Avoid ignored failure to install python2-libselinux,
something that should have being avoided from start (probably a lefover
hack from when we were adding fedora28 support).
Fixes: "Error: Nothing to do"

install-deps: Avoid PIP warnings related to where we were installing
executables ins ~/local/bin

repo-setup: remove deprecated syntax:
Avoid:
[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated. Instead of using
`result|match` use `result is match`. This feature will be removed in version
2.9. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by setting deprecation_warnings=False
in ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: I8f1eaac3d58c2ceb5cb07ba41bc80107219bd4cc

commit_message:
Retain one default for overcloud_container_cli

Previously overcloud_container_cli was defaulted in
three places - using different values and causing confusion.
This review leave the default in
roles/extras-common/defaults/main.yml and comments
the role default to refer there.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/679435
Change-Id: Ie886d7f9a3bdb914cfed3163f96418fa10947216

[{'created': '2019-08-30 12:51:08.000000000', 'message': "Disable voting on container-updates until 678695 is merged

We have a chicken and egg issue where we both need
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678695/ and
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679299/ to land so we can ahve the
container-updates job running on Podman and not Docker.

The reason is because we can't run Podman when Pacemaker is enabled on
CentOS7, so 679299 would never pass. We are going to break the CI job
when 679299 merges but 679299 will fix it by disabling Pacemaker.

This patch will be reverted soon after 678695 is merged.

Change-Id: Ie7e1a78238fcea22032bda1162006582dc8c1fe3
"}]
commit_message:
Disable voting on container-updates until 678695 is merged

We have a chicken and egg issue where we both need
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678695/ and
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679299/ to land so we can ahve the
container-updates job running on Podman and not Docker.

The reason is because we can't run Podman when Pacemaker is enabled on
CentOS7, so 679299 would never pass. We are going to break the CI job
when 679299 merges but 679299 will fix it by disabling Pacemaker.

This patch will be reverted soon after 678695 is merged.

Change-Id: Ie7e1a78238fcea22032bda1162006582dc8c1fe3

commit_message:
Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: I209a980f3345e037a7a9a1d9f89925e6eefa0c4e
(cherry picked from commit aee2164a3a91e120649e67301e8b365a4691770c)

commit_message:
Allow to globally set no_containers

Previously no_containers could be set only for specified host group.
This patch adds option to define no_containers inside global_overrides
to set fully bare_metal deployment across all host groups.

Change-Id: I375ce28cdb7489af631d4ad41dc1ecaa78bd6d49

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 16:13:43.000000000', 'message': 'Handle VirtDriverNotReady in _cleanup_running_deleted_instances

Change I6e086e0a2bffe12fd78373b3bc6215221dabc77e made the
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances task run immediately on
start of the nova-compute service. For some compute drivers, like
ironic, the "hypervisor" might not yet be ready to list instances
which results in a traceback exception in the logs.

This simply handles the VirtDriverNotReady error and returns to
avoid the traceback.

Change-Id: I6220a59988502a9839645efa101d555c19d4b650
Closes-Bug: #1842081
'}]
commit_message:
Handle VirtDriverNotReady in _cleanup_running_deleted_instances

Change I6e086e0a2bffe12fd78373b3bc6215221dabc77e made the
_cleanup_running_deleted_instances task run immediately on
start of the nova-compute service. For some compute drivers, like
ironic, the "hypervisor" might not yet be ready to list instances
which results in a traceback exception in the logs.

This simply handles the VirtDriverNotReady error and returns to
avoid the traceback.

Change-Id: I6220a59988502a9839645efa101d555c19d4b650
Closes-Bug: #1842081

subject: Remove flake8 from the test-requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-08-20 10:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2018-08-20 13:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-03 17:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-15 15:40:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I can go either way on this. On one hand, what you say is correct - flake8 isn't needed for anything else. On the other hand, every other project does things this way presumably for simplicity's sake. In fact, in nova we take advantage of this and use a shared environment for pretty much all non-Python versioned targets [1].

If you really want this, I'm happy to oblige (though I think we should also do the opposite - see inline). If it's not that important though, I'd rather we keep things the way they are. Your call :)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/396156eb/tox.ini#L58"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-12 16:46:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Given that this has been lingering for a long time and I still have some reservations about why we would do it, I'm going to -1. At the very least I would like to see the commit message updated to explain what benefit this brings as it isn't clear to me that either of the things mentioned are valid.

Also, since this is a common pattern across OpenStack, I'm curious if the plan is to make this change everywhere. Removing flake8 from mox3 doesn't buy us much since mox isn't used in most projects anymore."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-08-13 15:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-08-13 15:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-13 15:46:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Okay, this makes more sense to me now. Thanks for the explanation.

Since we don't use shared venvs I'm good with making this change here."}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2019-09-06 02:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 10:03:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove flake8 from the test-requirements

the linter is a blacklisted dependency, so we don't want to
pull it in for unit tests, as that causes any setup.py driven
build/install process to require flake8, which is not actually needed.

Also update to the newer flake8 2.6.x which is needed by current
hacking (which causes no fallout so should be fine).

Change-Id: I54f99e7e29c7b3727db98bdaf8bc168da3890a1d
"}, {'created': '2019-08-13 15:34:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove flake8 from the test-requirements

flake8 is a linter so we don't need to pull in for the unit
tests or other tox environments.

Also update to the newer flake8 2.6.x which is the version
chosen by current hacking release (which causes no fallout so should be fine).
Also this is the first version that is compatible being run
under python 3.6/7.

Change-Id: I54f99e7e29c7b3727db98bdaf8bc168da3890a1d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove flake8 from the test-requirements

flake8 is a linter so we don't need to pull in for the unit
tests or other tox environments.

Also update to the newer flake8 2.6.x which is the version
chosen by current hacking release (which causes no fallout so should be fine).
Also this is the first version that is compatible being run
under python 3.6/7.

Change-Id: I54f99e7e29c7b3727db98bdaf8bc168da3890a1d

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-07 20:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-07 20:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

general question by the way.
i notice that there are a few other image properties that
nova support but are not reflected in the metadefs.

the two patch i have up are for sperate feature that are being added in train so i have made them as spereate patchs but if i want to add metadefs for some of undocumeted image properties we support i assume it would be fine to group them in a larger patch rather then haveing a patch per feature.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-08 02:35:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@sean: yes, I think a general patch to bring the compute metadefs up to date would be fine.  It would be great if you could put one up.  Also, for the properties that go on images, we keep a doc page to supplement the metadefs, but it's probably missing some properties as well.  It's doc/source/admin/useful-image-properties.rst"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-08 02:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Which makes me realize that hw_pmu should be added to that doc.  Sorry about that.  It would probably be best to add it as part of this patch to keep the changes together.  doc/source/admin/useful-image-properties.rst'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-12 14:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

cool ill update that too. -w until that is done'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-15 19:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You should update the docs as well:

https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/useful-image-properties.html'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-20 14:44:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Heh, now I see that Brian said the same thing. I'm just piling on. :)"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-20 23:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

forgot to -w
the nova patch is currently in the gate so im going to update this now'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-21 00:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-22 13:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 26233, 'date': '2019-08-28 03:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-09-04 11:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

This looks good, Thanks for the docs and reno, definitely makes my life easier seeing it all there together.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-09-06 02:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks good.  Thanks, Sean.'}]

commit_message:
add hw_pmu metadef

This change adds a new hw_pmu metadef property to the
OS::Compute::LibvirtImage namespace and extends the train
metadef changes releasenote.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671338/

commit_message:
Follow-up: fix the invalid releasenote link

By reviewing OSC's releasenote document [1], I found that the
blueprint index is invalid. This patch fixes this problem.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-openstackclient/unreleased.html#new-features

Related-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665336
Part of blueprint support-specifying-az-when-restore-shelved-server

Change-Id: I14066dcfff5a585d51b4f365883a86a5cc086d45

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 11:10:00.000000000', 'message': "Run 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

Run 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit Run 'telemetry-dsvm-integration-ipv6-only' job in Panko gate.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35939

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

commit_message:
Avoid Kuryrnet populating pools before namespace handler finishes

This patch sets ensures kuryrnet handler does not start with the
pools prepopulation for a newly created subnets as soon as the
kuryrnet crd object is created, but waits for the namespace handler
to complete the namespace creation actions (subnet creations, sgs,
and finally namespace annotations with kuryrnetcrd)

Change-Id: Id85eace3763a67d404e3785003490478734af3c9

I agree the ironic CI job needs to be green before we merge a given one of these patches. It's red from here up, which probably means the problem is here (at least). I also pushed a dependent patch in ironic to test the series [1], and that's all red. Haven't gotten a chance to look into it further yet.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/675669"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-12 16:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-12 22:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-12 22:41:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

The failure here happened in discovery in the SDK [1]. That should have affected the predecessor patch just the same, but it didn't. The difference I can see is that the predecessor patch ran at openstacksdk 0.33.0 whereas this one ran at 0.32.0.

If the ironic job passes now, after the rebase, which should pick up openstacksdk 0.33.0, we should bump the minimum to that, and possibly look into blacklisting 0.32.x if we can figure out why it's broken.

[1] https://logs.opendev.org/27/656027/19/check/ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa/22721c8/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#_Aug_06_22_58_33_674078"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-13 00:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

[{'created': '2019-04-26 21:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'WIP/PoC: Use SDK instead of ironicclient for node.list

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for GET /v1/nodes [1].

The API call is invoked via the nodes SDK method [2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/?expanded=show-node-details-detail#list-nodes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/openstacksdk/latest/user/proxies/baremetal.html#openstack.baremetal.v1._proxy.Proxy.nodes

Change-Id: I751c36f76d726c55b397c62e3059911c2a7af107

commit_message:
Use SDK for node.list

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for GET /v1/nodes [1].

The API call is invoked via the nodes SDK method [2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/?expanded=show-node-details-detail#list-nodes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/openstacksdk/latest/user/proxies/baremetal.html#openstack.baremetal.v1._proxy.Proxy.nodes

NOTE: limit=0 has been removed in openstack/nova/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py:643,671,686,772.
      This is because the SDK returns a generator and handles paging transparently.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I751c36f76d726c55b397c62e3059911c2a7af107

This releases merged changes since the last release so they are included
in the stable/train branch creation.

commit_message:
Release monasca-statsd 1.12.0 for train

This releases not functional changes so they are included in the
stable/train branch. Minor version bump needed to ensure there is space
for any bugfix backports.

Change-Id: I395f3148b051eb2bd0a7bfafab6db0e34a05614c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Release ceilometermiddleware 1.5.0

Forcing a release to have a good point to create stable/train branch.
We need to bump up the minor release to have room in case of bugfix
backports.

Change-Id: I1a199c96e165c82b96be0d2b049cd7b2dc464bb1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-09-05 15:30:59.000000000', 'message': "train: release osc-placement 1.7.0

Minor version bump since there are new features.

$ git log --no-merges --oneline --no-decorate 1.6.0..origin/master

commit_message:
train: release osc-placement 1.7.0

Minor version bump since there are new features.

$ git log --no-merges --oneline --no-decorate 1.6.0..origin/master
8bbca01 Follow up for Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae
5cf7d77 Add --dry-run option to 'resource provider inventory set'
0ce562f Add --amend option to 'resource provider inventory set'
f08cb39 Add --aggregate option to 'resource provider inventory set'
51c0064 Cap sphinx for py2 to match global requirements

Change-Id: Ic0de7b7a05fefc930d507d150689dfe3cf07c598

commit_message:
testinfra : add system-config as required project

Because this job is defined in system-config repo, when it runs there
it has system-config.  When we're trying to run it against upstream
testinfra we need to ensure we pull it in explicitly.

Change-Id: I2bbba366501f10744ffaf26d1acfa54d652afae3

So, this change is tested with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678058. If you need another DNM change to test if this is working, that means that none of the current jobs is able to test this configuration, and also means that we are not protected against future regressions. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 15:12:52.000000000', 'message': "Add 'arch_tag' fact to the container tag when building non x86_64 images

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images  to registry.rdoproject.org
and need to tag images uniquely from the x86_64 versions. This patch adds an
arch_tag, of the format '_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images
when ansible_architecture is not x86_64. Upon promotion, the arch_tag should
be removed from the tag, a manifest should be created, and the images should
be uploaded to dockerhub.

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7
"}, {'created': '2019-06-11 17:25:38.000000000', 'message': "Add 'arch_tag' fact to the container tag when building non x86_64 images

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7
"}, {'created': '2019-06-25 15:47:24.000000000', 'message': "Add 'ansible_architecture' to container tag

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images  to
registry.rdoproject.org and need to tag images uniquely from the
x86_64 versions. This patch adds a suffix of the format
'_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images Upon
promotion, the suffix should be removed from the tag, a manifest
should be created, and the images should be uploaded to dockerhub.

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7
"}, {'created': '2019-08-06 20:38:29.000000000', 'message': "Introduce arch aware tag for container images

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images  to
registry.rdoproject.org and need to tag images uniquely from
the x86_64 versions. This patch adds a suffix of the format
'_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images. To ensure
backwards compatibility, x86_64 will also use the current tag
of format {{ version_hash }}. The retagging ansible scripts
are modified from an older patchset [0]. Upon promotion, the
suffix should be removed from the tag, a manifest should be
created, and the images should be uploaded to dockerhub.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660665/

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7

commit_message:
Introduce arch aware tag for container images

We will soon be pushing ppc64le container images to
registry.rdoproject.org and need to tag images uniquely from
the x86_64 versions. This patch adds a suffix of the format
'_{{ansible_architecture}}' to the tag of the images. To ensure
backwards compatibility, x86_64 will also use the current tag
of format {{ version_hash }}. The retagging ansible scripts
are modified from an older patchset [0]. Upon promotion, the
suffix should be removed from the tag, a manifest should be
created, and the images should be uploaded to dockerhub.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660665/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678907

Co-Authored-By: Rafael Folco <rfolco@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I537f577c8946ffeeed989a7c686ff85fef96a3f7

commit_message:
Enforce pep8/pyflakes rule on python codes

This change makes sure that we apply pyflake8 checks on all python
codes to improve its readability.

Note that there are some rules applied for other OpenStack projects,
but not yet turned on, which should be enabled in the future.

Change-Id: Iaf0299983d3a3fe48e3beb8f47bd33c21deb4972

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Fixes for deploying nova-less undercloud""

This reverts commit b5dec5b676a51cc9736d99dd67484a97aba47090 and
doesn't use exit_codes to add allowed exit code 5, which is what broke
the standalone CI job.

Change-Id: Ifff517161fa54ce5550516833bfc568e1f297069

commit_message:
Do not perform the tenant stack limit check for admin user

Removing stack creation limit for admin since admin can view all stacks,
and stacks created by other tenants would have been counted in the limit
check.

Change-Id: Ie2e9251245e7e16309661154e17724e5984c21e6
Story: 2003487
Task: 24756
(cherry picked from commit 22b14ff975f885c26b861d4d1b22577cca189e04)

Functional tests were failing because the testing environment was
unable to access the Internet without a HTTP proxy (available via

'}]
commit_message:
Tox: Make OS_* vars available to tests

Functional tests were failing because the testing environment was
unable to access the Internet without a HTTP proxy (available via
OS_HTTP_PROXY). This commits tells Tox to pass through OS_* vars.

Change-Id: I34abee914ffa7a0ee7711bf5cc01dba0241af9e4

commit_message:
Use connect_retries when creating clients

When creating session clients we should use 'connect_retries'
for clients that use Adapter interface. This will
allow retries when we get ConnectTimeout errors.

Task: 36331
Change-Id: Ic526c8039c91353e772eee7b55f1d263470c86bb
(cherry picked from commit 364716725a4767f8d9e3e5e1c76ecf4f969a6613
 and c7cc740f307ce8ffdf36c29094c9cbce5a6c8d14)

commit_message:
Fix resource leaks in IdentityPolicyAssociationRbacTest class

The IdentityPolicyAssociationRbacTest,
IdentityEndpointsV3RbacTest and EndpointFilterProjectsV3RbacTest
test cases were leaking region resources on the endpoint create
and just using tempest- in the region description.
The following changes to fix the leaks and make them easier to
find in the future, if they happen.

1) move setup_test_endpoint to the v3 class to have access to the
region client and get the region id created when the endpoint
created so I can add it to the resource clean-up.
2) add a rand_name for the region id not just the description
so we know that tempest- created it.

Change-Id: I3bd5bf02ef6d434ccba65a5a732e550b007a2309

Let's see if this really makes any improvement on the tempest-full overall run time after a few rechecks."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-05 18:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The stackviz on this one is very weird:

http://logs.openstack.org/00/650300/1/check/tempest-full-py3/cde75e1/controller/logs/stackviz/#/stdin/timeline

Note how there is a big gap with only 1 worker and then at the end there are 4 workers running scenarios tests when I'd only expect to see 2.

Similar issue in the py27 job:

http://logs.openstack.org/00/650300/1/check/tempest-full/1edb016/controller/logs/stackviz/#/stdin/timeline"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2019-04-08 22:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The 4 worker thing looks like because a --concurrency=4 is being injected to the cli somewhere: http://logs.openstack.org/00/650300/1/check/tempest-full/1edb016/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-04-05_15_59_13_791155'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-09 20:46:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yup nice catch, I'm assuming that's coming from here:
