revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-05 14:24:13.000000000', 'message': "Run scenario tests with --concurrency=2 in tempest-full job

We're still seeing lots of job timeouts from tempest-full
which excludes slow tests but still times out at a high rate [1].

Looking at stackviz results for a tempest-full job that passed,
it is clear that a good chunk of time is being spent running
scenario tests in serial even though we have 4 workers available.

In an attempt to speed this up but still try to be somewhat
conservative in how scenario tests are run concurrently, this
changes the tempest-full job to run the scenario tests with two
workers concurrently rather than serially.

The alternatives are:

1. Profile which tests are taking the longest and figure out why
   and then try to make them faster (best but hard to do).
2. Mark more tests as slow (easy but that just shifts the long
   running tests to the tempest-slow job which already has a 3
   hour timeout).
3. Re-consider if SSH validation should be enabled for tempest-full
   in the integrated gate and instead move that to some other
   dedicated job that does SSH validation (easy to do, but more
   redundant jobs which increases the chances of gate bugs to
   randomly fail a new voting job).
4. Extend the timeout on the tempest-full job (easy to do but it
   is already a 2 hour timeout).
5. Go through tempest's existing tests and figure out what should
   be moved to per-project plugins so they are not part of the
   integrated gate, assuming those tests aren't part of the
   interop guidelines in refstack (harder to do but probably good
   to do long-term anyway).

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Change-Id: I65db5259132ec8a1a084032c2632e49677a0fb66
Related-Bug: #1783405
"}, {'created': '2019-08-08 19:47:02.000000000', 'message': "Run scenario tests with --concurrency=2 in tempest-full job

We're still seeing lots of job timeouts from tempest-full
which excludes slow tests but still times out at a high rate [1].

Looking at stackviz results for a tempest-full job that passed,
it is clear that a good chunk of time is being spent running
scenario tests in serial even though we have 4 workers available.

In an attempt to speed this up but still try to be somewhat
conservative in how scenario tests are run concurrently, this
changes the tempest-full job to run the scenario tests with two
workers concurrently rather than serially.

The alternatives are:

1. Profile which tests are taking the longest and figure out why
   and then try to make them faster (best but hard to do).
2. Mark more tests as slow (easy but that just shifts the long
   running tests to the tempest-slow job which already has a 3
   hour timeout).
3. Re-consider if SSH validation should be enabled for tempest-full
   in the integrated gate and instead move that to some other
   dedicated job that does SSH validation (easy to do, but more
   redundant jobs which increases the chances of gate bugs to
   randomly fail a new voting job).
4. Extend the timeout on the tempest-full job (easy to do but it
   is already a 2 hour timeout).
5. Go through tempest's existing tests and figure out what should
   be moved to per-project plugins so they are not part of the
   integrated gate, assuming those tests aren't part of the
   interop guidelines in refstack (harder to do but probably good
   to do long-term anyway).

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Change-Id: I65db5259132ec8a1a084032c2632e49677a0fb66
Related-Bug: #1783405
"}]
commit_message:
Run scenario tests with --concurrency=2 in tempest-full job

We're still seeing lots of job timeouts from tempest-full
which excludes slow tests but still times out at a high rate [1].

Looking at stackviz results for a tempest-full job that passed,
it is clear that a good chunk of time is being spent running
scenario tests in serial even though we have 4 workers available.

In an attempt to speed this up but still try to be somewhat
conservative in how scenario tests are run concurrently, this
changes the tempest-full job to run the scenario tests with two
workers concurrently rather than serially.

The alternatives are:

1. Profile which tests are taking the longest and figure out why
   and then try to make them faster (best but hard to do).
2. Mark more tests as slow (easy but that just shifts the long
   running tests to the tempest-slow job which already has a 3
   hour timeout).
3. Re-consider if SSH validation should be enabled for tempest-full
   in the integrated gate and instead move that to some other
   dedicated job that does SSH validation (easy to do, but more
   redundant jobs which increases the chances of gate bugs to
   randomly fail a new voting job).
4. Extend the timeout on the tempest-full job (easy to do but it
   is already a 2 hour timeout).
5. Go through tempest's existing tests and figure out what should
   be moved to per-project plugins so they are not part of the
   integrated gate, assuming those tests aren't part of the
   interop guidelines in refstack (harder to do but probably good
   to do long-term anyway).

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Change-Id: I65db5259132ec8a1a084032c2632e49677a0fb66
Related-Bug: #1783405

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-22 15:42:18.000000000', 'message': "WIP: libvirt: dump console log if _clean_shutdown fails

We're seeing cirros guests in the gate failing to gracefully
shutdown within 60 seconds which is strange since they shouldn't
really be doing anything, and this could be contributing to
long test times and/or job timeouts.

This change is a simple debug patch to dump the guest console
log if we fail to cleanly shutdown the guest before destroying it.

Change-Id: I1bc1fe82ac015a92fe51d7dc5bd916b4a85c69e3
Related-Bug: #1829896
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: libvirt: dump console log if _clean_shutdown fails

We're seeing cirros guests in the gate failing to gracefully
shutdown within 60 seconds which is strange since they shouldn't
really be doing anything, and this could be contributing to
long test times and/or job timeouts.

This change is a simple debug patch to dump the guest console
log if we fail to cleanly shutdown the guest before destroying it.

Change-Id: I1bc1fe82ac015a92fe51d7dc5bd916b4a85c69e3
Related-Bug: #1829896

The commit message on this change needs to clearly explain how the patch fixes the problem described in the bug. So far, it is not clear to me how/why this change fixes the bug.'}, {'account_id': 28354, 'date': '2019-02-19 00:58:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > The commit message on this change needs to clearly explain how the
 > patch fixes the problem described in the bug. So far, it is not
 > clear to me how/why this change fixes the bug.

the instance's type is ironic and vm_state is error,then the user rebuild the instance, the `_wait_for_active` method check 'instance.vm_state',if the state is error,it will raise an exception.

so we can change the `instance.vm_state` to `vm_states.BUILDING` to avoid the `_wait_for_active` method raise exception and really to wait for active"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-05 21:45:10.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/523559/ is a better fix and is approved so I'm going to abandon this one."}]

commit_message:
Use separate plays for Host prep steps

Instead of using one task include per role in the same play, use
separate plays instead. This reduces the amount of task skipping that
Ansible has to do since each include only applies to a single role.

In a deployment with many roles, this will improve performance.

Change-Id: I01ef631ea3dad8b9c030d61ed0883a9af13616ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 20:15:46.000000000', 'message': 'Trap and log errors from _update_inst_info_cache_for_disassociated_fip

When associating a floating IP to instance A and the floating IP is
already associated to instance B, the associate_floating_ip method
updates the floating IP to be associated with instance A then tries
to update the network info cache for instance B. That network info
cache update is best effort and could fail in different ways, e.g.
the original associated port or instance could be gone. Failing to
refresh the cache for instance B should not affect the association
operation for instance A, so this change traps any errors during the
refresh and just logs them as a warning.

Change-Id: Ib5a44e4fd2ec2bf43b761db29403810d8b730429
Related-Bug: #1826472
'}]
commit_message:
Trap and log errors from _update_inst_info_cache_for_disassociated_fip

When associating a floating IP to instance A and the floating IP is
already associated to instance B, the associate_floating_ip method
updates the floating IP to be associated with instance A then tries
to update the network info cache for instance B. That network info
cache update is best effort and could fail in different ways, e.g.
the original associated port or instance could be gone. Failing to
refresh the cache for instance B should not affect the association
operation for instance A, so this change traps any errors during the
refresh and just logs them as a warning.

Change-Id: Ib5a44e4fd2ec2bf43b761db29403810d8b730429
Related-Bug: #1826472

commit_message:
neutron: refactor nw info cache refresh out of associate_floating_ip

This is a simple refactor to associate_floating_ip which moves
the code that handles refreshing the network info cache on the
instance originally associated with the floating IP out of the
main associate_floating_ip method. This is mostly to make unit
testing of that refesh code simpler in isolation.

Change-Id: Ie5d2724e61052756dc7239f25b1fb6eb0df96378

subject: Self-resetting PrivContext
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-23 23:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-24 00:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I tested this in my devstack. In conjunction with the oslo.service fix [1], I was able to spawn instances after (multiple) SIGHUPs.

More savvy folk should look closely for threading/locking pratfalls and memory/socket leaks I've undoubtedly perpetrated.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641907/"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-24 00:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-26 20:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Okay, I added a test to the "functional" test framework at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678653

Note that I'm doing some naughty things with sudo there, so run at your own risk (also why the parent patch isn't actually in the repo).

I did unfortunately find an edge case where this explodes, which is that if a privileged call is made in very close proximity to the SIGHUP it can still fail. I assume what's happening is that the socket hasn't noticed that the process went away and so we get a different error. I wasn't immediately able to figure out how to gracefully handle that situation because it gets raised after the new block that checks for channel re-init. I decided to post my initial results for further discussion before digging too much deeper. I'm not sure how serious it is if the first privileged call after a SIGHUP fails, although I imagine it's caller-specific and we should really handle it in the library. :-/

Also, one nit inline.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-26 21:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Found a kind of brute force method to address the timing problem. The latest version of my test patch now has a retry wrapper around the _wrap function that allows the tests to pass without any workarounds.

I should also mention, though, that this probably doesn't work for the forking method of starting the daemon. When we use that, we drop privileges in the parent process and thus have no way to restart the daemon with the necessary privileges afterward. Fortunately, I don't think we need to worry about that for OpenStack. I don't find any uses of Method.FORK in any of our repos: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=Method.FORK&i=nope&files=&repos=

If someone wants to use mutable config and a forking privsep daemon at some point in the future we can deal with it then. In the meantime we should probably just document the limitation."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-28 20:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-28 20:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

bnemec and I tried for a couple of days to figure out a way to test this properly and ultimately agreed that, since this was validated live, we'll live with the lack of UT and work more on that "later".'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-28 21:10:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Yeah, this certainly isn't making the situation any worse. Previously if the privsep daemon died your service was completely unable to make privileged calls until it was restarted. While this does still have some timing issues if a call comes in very close to when the daemon is killed, at least it works for the vast majority of cases. It also has the benefit of dealing with the situation where a call causes the privsep daemon to just crash (as we saw in Neutron a while back).

I will note that I'm still seeing a hang when running the functional test against this version and it would be nice to at least make that an immediate failure, but again it's not making things any worse and there is a traceback logged in that case so it's not a silent failure."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-29 14:02:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This looks sane and that's about as much as I can say"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-09-05 20:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 9e09a179305b77ea1985c7d2944c91266a97e10e'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 23:59:34.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Self-resetting PrivContext

When nova-compute, an oslo.service, receives SIGHUP, running PrivContext
clients terminate, resulting in the shutdown of their corresponding
ClientChannel threads. Subsequent attempts to execute privileged methods
fail with EPIPE as a result.

The PrivContext._wrap'per (the meat of the entrypoint decorator) already
had a check to lazily start() the ClientChannel if that hasn't already
happened.

This commit makes ClientChannel store state indicating whether it's
still running; and adds logic to PrivContext._wrap to check that state
and reset (stop() and re-start()) the ClientChannel if it was previously
created but terminated.

WIP: UT

Change-Id: I8096fc7fd014e6dd299fae8ab073336c7cae362a
Closes-Bug: #1715374
"}, {'created': '2019-08-28 20:35:20.000000000', 'message': "Self-resetting PrivContext

When nova-compute, an oslo.service, receives SIGHUP, running PrivContext
clients terminate, resulting in the shutdown of their corresponding
ClientChannel threads. Subsequent attempts to execute privileged methods
fail with EPIPE as a result.

The PrivContext._wrap'per (the meat of the entrypoint decorator) already
had a check to lazily start() the ClientChannel if that hasn't already
happened.

This commit makes ClientChannel store state indicating whether it's
still running; and adds logic to PrivContext._wrap to check that state
and reset (stop() and re-start()) the ClientChannel if it was previously
created but terminated.

Change-Id: I8096fc7fd014e6dd299fae8ab073336c7cae362a
Closes-Bug: #1715374
"}]
commit_message:
Self-resetting PrivContext

When nova-compute, an oslo.service, receives SIGHUP, running PrivContext
clients terminate, resulting in the shutdown of their corresponding
ClientChannel threads. Subsequent attempts to execute privileged methods
fail with EPIPE as a result.

The PrivContext._wrap'per (the meat of the entrypoint decorator) already
had a check to lazily start() the ClientChannel if that hasn't already
happened.

This commit makes ClientChannel store state indicating whether it's
still running; and adds logic to PrivContext._wrap to check that state
and reset (stop() and re-start()) the ClientChannel if it was previously
created but terminated.

Change-Id: I8096fc7fd014e6dd299fae8ab073336c7cae362a
Closes-Bug: #1715374

subject: restart: don't stop process on sighup when mutating
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 17669, 'name': 'Doug Szumski', 'email': 'doug@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'DougSzumski'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]

[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-03-08 03:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-08 13:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From a semantics this doesn't seems like the right change.

restart() is a thing that should be available, and mean what the current implementation is doing: stop, change, start.

sighup should mean reload() (just change, not stop and start) and should probably have it's own method.

However, if everyone and their cousin has already implemented sighup to call restart then I guess we're stuck."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-03-08 13:55:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Right, so should be implement another handler for SIGHUP which calls reset() which only does a reset()?

Also, the restart() is incorrectly named, it actually handles SIGHUP.  It seems all downstream components have implemented reset() with the assumption that stop() and start() won't be called.  You can see this in the related bugs"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-03-08 14:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-03-08 14:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-03-08 15:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-03-08 16:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-03-08 22:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This appears to have been the behaviour since 2013. It seems surprising that this is suddenly a blocker for upgrades? Is it possible that how we're using it has changed?

I'm trying to think of a good reason it should work that way, and the only thing I'm coming up with is that it ensures that the config changes only while no operation is running, so a given worker never sees an inconsistent config.

If folks generally agree that this was the wrong way to do it, then I'm OK with a change in this direction.

Docs should also be updated: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.service/latest/user/usage.html#signal-handling"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-03-08 23:19:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It seems that Nova as a downstream (and heavy user of SIGHUP) assumes that the process isn't restarted.

If the process is restarted, any inflight operations would be lost.  The idea is SIGHUP avoids that.  I'd like to perhaps hear Dan's feedback on this."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-03-09 01:02:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If the process is restarted, any inflight operations would be lost.

If stopping is bad why doesn't Nova pass graceful=True here: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/service.py#n291 ?"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-03-09 01:09:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I thought of another reason it might be implemented this way: if you change the RPC config then it won't get picked up unless you stop the service and start it again with the new config."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-03-25 19:45:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I thought of another reason it might be implemented this way: if
 > you change the RPC config then it won't get picked up unless you
 > stop the service and start it again with the new config.

That's not really legit though, I don't think. When the mutable config stuff was first brought up, we said things like "db connection shouldn't be mutable because switching that on a live service is unlikely to be done properly". I think the same is true for RPC here, as evidenced by the bug we have in nova for this. If we didn't need to exclude some things, we wouldn't have needed the mutable=True flag to oslo.config to define what is and isn't reloadable.

Further, I'd say that this default and very forceful oslo.service behavior of basically just restarting the whole service could be an _optional_ way to handle HUP if you're naive, but it shouldn't be the _only_ way. It effectively prevents nova from doing what is _actually_ proper HUP behavior.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-25 20:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Further, I'd say that this default and very forceful oslo.service behavior of basically just restarting the whole service could be an _optional_ way to handle HUP if you're naive, but it shouldn't be the _only_ way. It effectively prevents nova from doing what is _actually_ proper HUP behavior.

If we're trying to be really conservative with this, could we add a config option to oslo.service which is deprecated right away but defaults to the old busted behavior, but then people configuring nova to change it to do a new better thing (this change), and then with some time baked in we can change the default to do the new thing only, and eventually drop the old busted behavior?

In thinking about backports for this, we'd have to do a release and minimum requirements bump just to be sure we're using it in nova in Stein GA, but really for backports there would be no minimum required version bump for this in nova on stable branches, either the option would be there or it's not, and it's up to operators to pick up the backported version of the backward-compatible change and use it if needed.

Also note that you need at least a "fixes" release note on this if it's fixing, albeit broken, behavior so people can at least be aware something changed.

If we don't land this in time for Stein GA, we should probably put a known issue release note in nova's Stein release notes, even though this isn't a new regression in nova for Stein right?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-03-25 20:24:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If we don't land this in time for Stein GA, we should probably put
 > a known issue release note in nova's Stein release notes, even
 > though this isn't a new regression in nova for Stein right?

No, based on my research, this is a long standing bug."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-04-05 14:15:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Should this behavior vary depending on whether the restart_method is mutate or reload? This change is intended to make the mutate case work as expected, but it probably doesn't work for reload, right? It isn't safe to completely reload the config and not restart the service.

FWIW, I do agree that we need to change this behavior. It sounds like basically every deployment tool has run into this either for log rotation or upgrades (or both)."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-16 20:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-16 20:15:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think this addresses all of the comments from the original PS and includes what we discussed in Denver. I haven't tried to write any kind of functional or unit tests, but hopefully we can test it out with OSA to verify that it actually fixes the problem."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-16 21:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

TIL that the problem we're trying to nail in nova is:

After SIGHUP, creating instances fails.

So I tried it in my devstack, first reproducing the problem without the fix, then applying the fix and trying the same procedure again. TL;DR: The problem still exists with this fix. Which doesn't mean it's wrong; it's just not sufficient, and it is unclear to me whether the next step is here, in privsep, or in nova.

Some details [1]. That this confirms mriedem's analysis in bug 1715374 [2] starting at comment 34 [3] (which is different from the symptom in opener of that bug).

So while this patch may resolve the second bug [4], it does not resolve the first one. I'm therefore downvoting simply to have that removed from the commit message. Otherwise this seems like a valid fix for [4].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/762694/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1715374
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1715374/comments/34
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.service/+bug/1794708"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-23 19:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Okay, I will drop the first one from this patch.

I wonder if the privsep daemon dies on sighup, which makes subsequent privileged calls fail. Maybe we need to create a new privsep context in the handler?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-23 19:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-23 19:26:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Thanks Ben. I'll take a look at the privsep context thing."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-24 00:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Combining this patch with [1] (oslo.privsep fix) resolved bug 1715374 (I was able to create instances after SIGHUPping n-cpu).

So I think this one is good to go, and we'll want to pull it into nova ASAP.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678323/"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-24 00:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 03:14:48.000000000', 'message': "restart: don't stop process on sighup

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop() and start() functionality, allowing
processes to reset exactly what they want in their code.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708
"}, {'created': '2019-07-16 20:10:43.000000000', 'message': "restart: don't stop process on sighup

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop() and start() functionality, allowing
processes to reset exactly what they want in their code.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-19 17:23:01.000000000', 'message': "restart: don't stop process on sighup when mutating

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop and start when the restart_method is
set to 'mutate' because in that case we should just be signaling
the service to check for changes in its mutable config options.
It also changes the signal sent to children in that case to
SIGHUP, since SIGTERM will cause unnecessary restarts of child
processes.

The previous behavior is maintained for the 'reload' restart_method
since that does a complete reload of the service config, which is
not safe to do without restarting the service completely.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-20 20:57:12.000000000', 'message': "restart: don't stop process on sighup when mutating

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop and start when the restart_method is
set to 'mutate' because in that case we should just be signaling
the service to check for changes in its mutable config options.
It also changes the signal sent to children in that case to
SIGHUP, since SIGTERM will cause unnecessary restarts of child
processes.

The previous behavior is maintained for the 'reload' restart_method
since that does a complete reload of the service config, which is
not safe to do without restarting the service completely.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1715374
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop and start when the restart_method is
set to 'mutate' because in that case we should just be signaling
the service to check for changes in its mutable config options.
It also changes the signal sent to children in that case to
SIGHUP, since SIGTERM will cause unnecessary restarts of child
processes.

The previous behavior is maintained for the 'reload' restart_method
since that does a complete reload of the service config, which is
not safe to do without restarting the service completely.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

commit_message:
restart: don't stop process on sighup when mutating

It seems that the code for handling SIGHUP currently calls stop()
on the service, then calls reset(), then calls start() on it again.

This is effectively a full service restart, which breaks the whole
point behind using SIGHUP for hot and quick reloads.  It also breaks
our downstream projects in a few ways where they lose RPC on reload
due to the fact that they don't expect to have stop() called on a
reset().

This patch removes the stop and start when the restart_method is
set to 'mutate' because in that case we should just be signaling
the service to check for changes in its mutable config options.
It also changes the signal sent to children in that case to
SIGHUP, since SIGTERM will cause unnecessary restarts of child
processes.

The previous behavior is maintained for the 'reload' restart_method
since that does a complete reload of the service config, which is
not safe to do without restarting the service completely.

Change-Id: I86a34c22d41d87a9cce2d4ac6d95562d05823ecf
Closes-Bug: #1794708
Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable overcloud_upgrade only for master to master jobs

In order to run master to master jobs, we need to enable
the tags for overcloud_upgrade only

Change-Id: I6a9a697c80e0269b6b05bd6703cf6c84a1fc2abe
Depends-On: Ifb8b83dde1c5c959e1075231a4c78d4063dcf53b
Depends-On: I1c394484f04d65ff1996825a723ffa14f045a276

commit_message:
update to use emit_releases for fs051

It looks like fs051 is not configured to use
the emit_releases python script that determines
the correct release for deployments, updates,
and upgrades.

target_upgrade_version should be defined with
this patch included.

Closes-Bug: #1811450
Depends-On: Ie0612902c0b6ca00ce5b9bea3690d6131e9e4bfe
Depends-On: I73e38cf5be601fc22d1509b05c08b7d520c50064
Change-Id: Ifcbff4c848b24641f8f937db0745b0483a05a437

commit_message:
Modify validation and add Molecule tests for rabbitmq-limits

We can't easily add host variables, meaning we have to modify the
validation in order to accept external variable.

The Molecule test validate it's still working as expected.

Change-Id: I81edce1f949c0ad38d4ccef2a94a45f455cd9a9c

commit_message:
Remove required projects for sanity job

This commit removes required projects for the sanity job. It should be
better to remove them since we don't need for sanity checking.

Change-Id: Iad2f9f3d08aa1a422a6a94cd56467a16f683fa3b

[{'created': '2019-09-04 10:21:30.000000000', 'message': 'Set ceph_grafana_vip to storage_dashboard network

When storage_dashboard composable network is defined, we need
to set ceph_grafana_vip to this network following the same
pattern of the other services.
If storage_dashboard composable network is not defined, no
additional changes are needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674318
Change-Id: Ib393e2e65821e347179c0c20b87feb99d6d84982
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-09-04 10:30:16.000000000', 'message': 'Set ceph_grafana_vip on storage_dashboard network

When storage_dashboard composable network is defined, we need
to set ceph_grafana_vip on this network following the same
pattern of the other services and creating an exception.
If storage_dashboard composable network is not defined, no
additional changes are needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674318
Change-Id: Ib393e2e65821e347179c0c20b87feb99d6d84982
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set ceph_grafana_vip on storage_dashboard network

When storage_dashboard composable network is defined, we need
to set ceph_grafana_vip on this network following the same
pattern of the other services and creating an exception.
If storage_dashboard composable network is not defined, no
additional changes are needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674318
Change-Id: Ib393e2e65821e347179c0c20b87feb99d6d84982
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 14:49:59.000000000', 'message': "Fluentd: Add support for arbitrary environment vars

This updates the Fluentd deployment template to use the helm
toolkit util for generating environment variables through the
chart's values.yaml. This adds flexibility in defining fluentd
outputs, as arbitrary environment variables can be injected and
consumed in fluentd's filters and outputs

Change-Id: I72a2c476378cc555bde1387781b4a06f13b51bc6
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-09-04 15:26:46.000000000', 'message': "Fluentd: Add support for arbitrary environment vars

This updates the Fluentd deployment template to use the helm
toolkit util for generating environment variables through the
chart's values.yaml. This adds flexibility in defining fluentd
outputs, as arbitrary environment variables can be injected and
consumed in fluentd's filters and outputs

Change-Id: I72a2c476378cc555bde1387781b4a06f13b51bc6
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fluentd: Add support for arbitrary environment vars

This updates the Fluentd deployment template to use the helm
toolkit util for generating environment variables through the
chart's values.yaml. This adds flexibility in defining fluentd
outputs, as arbitrary environment variables can be injected and
consumed in fluentd's filters and outputs

Change-Id: I72a2c476378cc555bde1387781b4a06f13b51bc6
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Ide4de6aa418aa9ee66fca41378677b73312a847d
Story: #2005924
Task: #34206

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Story: #2005924
Task: #34208

Change-Id: I2dee048b71e3758208fae438423cceae661c8f00

commit_message:
temporary disable functional tests

we have to merge python3-train changes but new bug in keystone
prevents this commit.
we have fix for keystone and we checked that functional job passes
with that fix.
so I suggest to switch off functional job to merge python3-train
and then I'll revert functional job

keystone fix: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677239/

Change-Id: I939821aee613895672c61a575a0700e55ce4a3b8

subject: Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"
messages:
[{'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2019-08-20 22:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30676, 'date': '2019-08-21 23:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Indeed, numeric project and user ids >>still<< exist in some Openstack installations, and would be next to impossible to root out.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-08-29 07:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

hi Andy, Can you briefly describe what problem you are facing in a bug. How removing this exception solves your problem? 
Because anything other than uuid should always be checked before getting any project/user.'}, {'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:37:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> hi Andy, Can you briefly describe what problem you are facing in a
 > bug. How removing this exception solves your problem?
 > Because anything other than uuid should always be checked before
 > getting any project/user.

I'll create a bug report for this, but simply, older OpenStack installations can have user and project IDs that are not UUIDs.

the get_tenant() and get_user() calls will fail for those users and projects."}, {'account_id': 18418, 'date': '2019-08-29 23:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-05 15:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-09-05 16:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit f8b694a5391cb1facf5fc3c98e779497308d9f8a'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 22:49:54.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"

In the early days of OpenStack, user and project ids were not
uuids, but auto-incremented integers.

Since those early days, many operators fought long battles
against the unrelenting OpenStack behemoth.

Only those heroic operators who emerged victorious from the
brutal upgrade battles can show the scars of those integer
user and project ids like badges of honour.

Change-Id: I0c3e3465e8e7499c94d1a82b7295aeec13955e55
'}, {'created': '2019-08-29 23:00:03.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"

Since those early days, many operators fought long battles
against the unrelenting OpenStack behemoth.

Only those heroic operators who emerged victorious from the

commit_message:
Revert "Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid"

In the early days of OpenStack, user and project ids were not
uuids, but auto-incremented integers.

Since those early days, many operators fought long battles
against the unrelenting OpenStack behemoth.

Only those heroic operators who emerged victorious from the
brutal upgrade battles can show the scars of those integer
user and project ids like badges of honour.

Closes-Bug: #1842004
Change-Id: I0c3e3465e8e7499c94d1a82b7295aeec13955e55

commit_message:
Don't allow retype to encrypted+multiattach type

This maintains consistency with our policy of not allowing the
combination of encryption and multiattach in commit
18327971ca7231807294a6b1dbf3d80c23cb6796

Change-Id: I1c22bc86d96bb1cab80c004d3450b1dac6c4a769

commit_message:
Fluentd: Add support for daemonset update strategy

This adds support for configuring fluentd's update strategy when
deployed as a daemonset, as this was previously missed when
the changes to support both daemonsets and deployments were made

Change-Id: I5ac4fbfc0e64caaf207de42cd71c893f8d0f6ff1
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I323b079ec538ebc2184724325fad00bbe2092e9b

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Passing OS env vars instead of AMULET
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.
- adding bionic-stein bundle to gate_bundles instead of dev

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: Ia7093a5654a763670be05635f7f6fce292eb9c96

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Ica4bead71d054ae5912e7e66ff9a0666e131637a

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- changed the location of memcached dur to an issue with the charm store
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Idf5e729fcde85ff7442282a711130f4132e17a85

subject: Adds API-Schema guideline
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 6525, 'name': 'Gilles Dubreuil', 'email': 'gilles@redhat.com', 'username': 'q-1illes-a'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6525, 'date': '2017-12-01 04:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-12-06 11:10:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Hi! I have to admit, I'm a bit confused by the purpose of this work. I think even the very first addition to our guidelines should be a bit more clear and what we discuss and what we see as the end result. Please see more comments inline."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:44:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think it is fine to start a review as a placeholder for discussion on this matter but agree that we need a bit more discussion to figure out what the goals are and what the guidance will really mean. For example is the eventual outcome of this discussion that there will be guidance that recommends that API producers provide schema?

I can see the benefits of that, but I'm not sure that is something we want to strongly recommend. Whereas service catalogs and version discovery are something we've to which we've made a strong commitment, I'm not convinced (yet) that we want to make the same strength of commitment to schema. Maybe a weaker commitment. Maybe no commitment at all.

In any case, as this document evolves, besides making sure it has the content we want it should also have the formatting we want. In this case the problem is not wrapping at <= 79 columns."}, {'account_id': 6525, 'date': '2017-12-07 23:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(5 comments)

commit_message:
Adds API-Schema guideline

This is the initial place holder for API Schema guidance document.
Since there are no specs file this also describes the current situation
and what to do to obtain the API schemas.

Change-Id: I9e781fb67de281d642f5b2ac7a41ae0e178c0adb

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 20:47:24.000000000', 'message': 'Always specify interface for vips

Currently the interfaces end up being detected during the deploy however
this only works when the undercloud_*_host configurations use the same
ip cidr as the local_ip. We should define this to be the br-ctlplane by
default, however this may need to be configured differently when the
user is using their on network configuration override.  We will also
throw warnings about these configurations when this type of
configuration occurs. The end user can override these via their own
custom env file if they want the vips to end up on a different
interface.

Change-Id: I32b44184a840ec7932a812ce0fabaa0256061993
Closes-Bug: #1841850

commit_message:
Always specify interface for vips

Currently the interfaces end up being detected during the deploy however
this only works when the undercloud_*_host configurations use the same
ip cidr as the local_ip. We should define this to be the br-ctlplane by
default, however this may need to be configured differently when the
user is using their on network configuration override.  We will also
throw warnings about these configurations when this type of
configuration occurs. The end user can override these via their own
custom env file if they want the vips to end up on a different
interface.

Change-Id: I32b44184a840ec7932a812ce0fabaa0256061993
Closes-Bug: #1841850

commit_message:
temporary disable functional tests

we have to merge python3-train changes but new bug in keystone
prevents this commit.
we have fix for keystone and we checked that functional job passes
with that fix.
so I suggest to switch off functional job to merge python3-train
and then I'll revert functional job

keystone fix: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677239/

Change-Id: I939821aee613895672c61a575a0700e55ce4a3b8

commit_message:
Fix 'test_get_devices_info_veth_different_namespaces' failure

If there is already a separate interface or bridge in namespace,
adding an interface to namespace will result in a link device by default.
Closes-Bug: #1842482

Change-Id: I4c8ffb258a3e1ef6c30f27eb0a1ead2de6f208a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-01 23:30:15.000000000', 'message': 'Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests

Currently the unit testing suite has a minimal set of IPs
hard-coded (in the subnet 10.0.0.0/8). The failing unit tests call
functions that will perform DNS reverse lookups on the hard-coded
IPs. In the event that a DNS server is unavailable, or misconfigured,
the DNS lookups will result in a Python Exception being thrown,
causing the unit tests to fail.

This solution patches DNS lookups to return None result.

Change-Id: I7a519fbe7fba5f3aefd22c57b8d44e3b39c99582
Closes-Bug: #1841806
'}, {'created': '2019-09-04 20:35:23.000000000', 'message': 'Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests

Currently the unit testing suite has a minimal set of IPs
hard-coded (in the subnet 10.0.0.0/8). The failing unit tests call
functions that will perform DNS reverse lookups on the hard-coded
IPs. In the event that a DNS server is unavailable, or misconfigured,
the DNS lookups will result in a Python Exception being thrown,
causing the unit tests to fail.

This solution patches DNS lookups to return None result.

Also add OS_* to tox passenv to resolve the http proxy issue in
retrieving the cirros image.

Change-Id: I7a519fbe7fba5f3aefd22c57b8d44e3b39c99582
Closes-Bug: #1841806
'}]
commit_message:
Patch DNS lookups in Unit tests

Currently the unit testing suite has a minimal set of IPs
hard-coded (in the subnet 10.0.0.0/8). The failing unit tests call
functions that will perform DNS reverse lookups on the hard-coded
IPs. In the event that a DNS server is unavailable, or misconfigured,
the DNS lookups will result in a Python Exception being thrown,
causing the unit tests to fail.

This solution patches DNS lookups to return None result.

Also add OS_* to tox passenv to resolve the http proxy issue in
retrieving the cirros image.

Change-Id: I7a519fbe7fba5f3aefd22c57b8d44e3b39c99582
Closes-Bug: #1841806

commit_message:
Docs: Fix launch an instance from a volume

The block-device is a parameter of nova-client command, using it
in OSC will raise CommandError.

Also we can use "--volume" for the instance
boot from an existing source image, volume, or snapshot.

Change-Id: Iadf1b6757c28db80312bae4d1ed385e5a1a4184f

commit_message:
Libvirt: Rename _guest_add_memory_balloon

The virtual memory balloon device will be added by
Libvirt as a default behavior.[1]

The option mem_stats_period_seconds only set guest memory
statistics period.

Closes-Bug: #1840139

[1] https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsMemBalloon

Change-Id: Id87695de562393ecd608fb7cb463f612f3f18f9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 04:51:04.000000000', 'message': 'Drop cinder_volume packages installation for source

cinder_volume_distro_packages variable was designed for distro installs.
This patch remove these packages installation from source installs

Change-Id: I746c800dc75b39f57f7c707aedf35f6814cfdef0
'}, {'created': '2019-09-04 07:03:48.000000000', 'message': "Rename cinder distro packages to match convention

This patch splits distro variables into two:
- cinder_*_distro_packages defines dependant packages
- cinder_*_service_distro_packages defines cinder service packages itself

So that we're installing cinder_*_distro_packages both for source and distro
installs while cinder_*_service_distro_packages are only for distro ones.

Also it seems that we may drop separate task for isntalling cinder volume
dependecies as they do not contain anything ceph specific.

Change-Id: I746c800dc75b39f57f7c707aedf35f6814cfdef0

commit_message:
Rename cinder distro packages to match convention

This patch splits distro variables into two:
- cinder_*_distro_packages defines dependant packages
- cinder_*_service_distro_packages defines cinder service packages itself

So that we're installing cinder_*_distro_packages both for source and distro
installs while cinder_*_service_distro_packages are only for distro ones.

Also since only qemu-tools depends on librbd, we leave it alone in
cinder_volume_distro_packages_tools.

Change-Id: I746c800dc75b39f57f7c707aedf35f6814cfdef0

We attempt a reset but if the installation is being run in a non-tty
friendly way, reset may fail.  Since this isn't really a blocking issue

Closes-Bug: #1842677
"}]
commit_message:
Log a warning when reset fails

We attempt a reset but if the installation is being run in a non-tty
friendly way, reset may fail.  Since this isn't really a blocking issue
we shouldn't fail out of the installation but rather log a warning
indicating that the user may need to perform some action.

Change-Id: I26f41457b712810b54d4108f735a1db3c88ae8ce
Closes-Bug: #1842677

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: I07d08bb2c5ea351dc2ad697c5889bd97d04f7c7c

commit_message:
Check if workflow execution is empty in integrity checker

* Method get_workflow_execution() raises an exception if the workflow
  execution does not exist. Since this is a valid case (the method
  may be called via scheduler after the execution is deleted)
  we need to smoothly handle it.

Change-Id: Ibd6099f1e0fd07c71130f11457b355a367229977

commit_message:
add table of available cleaning steps to documentation

The documentation currently has no information at all about what steps
are available *generally* for automated or manual cleaning. Users who
want to find this information must review the source code themselves,
except in one or two cases where driver-specific documentation has the
details spelled out.

This patch adds a series of tables to the general cleaning
documentation to provide details about the steps one could possibly
add to the instructions given to ironic, along with details about
required parameters and what the effect of each step will be.

Change-Id: I6b225cce38b815248c457814508531041c437e6d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Adding bionic stein test
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I405577811e23918aca946f7a7da2adaf54678dcc

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Added test bundles bionic-queens, bionic-rocky, disco-stein
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Ie314f8e8914bce87606bbce442ebd28bc5be4bce

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

commit_message:
Add Drive resource support

This change adds basic Redfish Drive resource support to the
dynamic Redfish emulator. As of this patch, the only backend
for the Redfish Drives implemented is static config (Flask)
file.

Change-Id: I867cea6263a8a934dd90169b783893be46d75d36

commit_message:
Add Storage and Storage Controllers resource support

This change adds basic Redfish Storage and Storage Controllers
support to the dynamic Redfish emulator. As of this patch, the
only backend for the Redfish Storage implemented is static
config (Flask) file.

[{'created': '2019-09-04 04:51:33.000000000', 'message': 'Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I6fbddc841039a9a66998b4ca7ae81742852d12ae
'}]
commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I6fbddc841039a9a66998b4ca7ae81742852d12ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-13 10:53:11.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Libvirt: add nfv job

- This change introduces nfv nodesets that are based on fedora-29
- This change introduces tempest-nfv and tempest-nfv-multinode jobs
- This change disables gate jobs to speed up developemnt of the nfv
  jobs.

The tempest-nfv job uses the qemu multi threaded tiny code
generator backend (MTTCG) to enable cpu pinning without kvm.
This requires a recent qemu and libvit 5.1.rc2 or newer.
libvirt 5.1.rc2 removes a hardcoded check that prevents cpu
pinning being enabled when qemu is used without kvm.
qemu automatically enables the MTTCG backed on supported
architechtures when a compatible cpu model is used.
To "force" the use of MTTCG we use cpu_mode=custom
and set the cpu_model to qemu64.

The tempest-nfv job operates by executing the standard
tempest test suite using nfv flavors to ensure that standard
operation function when using cpu pinning, hugepages, realtime
and an explicit numa topology of 1 numa node. addtionally
this tests emulator_threads isolate and share.

Change-Id: I8884a20d1cd81f5c43f43ed6575990110d75bc37
'}, {'created': '2019-04-13 10:57:28.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Libvirt: add nfv job

- This change introduces nfv nodesets that are based on fedora-29
- This change introduces tempest-nfv and tempest-nfv-multinode jobs
- This change disables gate jobs to speed up developemnt of the nfv
  jobs.

The tempest-nfv job uses the qemu multi threaded tiny code
generator backend (MTTCG) to enable cpu pinning without kvm.
This requires a recent qemu and libvit 5.1.rc2 or newer.
libvirt 5.1.rc2 removes a hardcoded check that prevents cpu
pinning being enabled when qemu is used without kvm.
qemu automatically enables the MTTCG backed on supported
architechtures when a compatible cpu model is used.
To "force" the use of MTTCG we use cpu_mode=custom
and set the cpu_model to qemu64.

The tempest-nfv job operates by executing the standard
tempest test suite using nfv flavors to ensure that standard
operation function when using cpu pinning, hugepages, realtime
and an explicit numa topology of 1 numa node. addtionally
this tests emulator_threads isolate and share.

Change-Id: I8884a20d1cd81f5c43f43ed6575990110d75bc37

commit_message:
Libvirt: add nfv job

- This change introduces nfv nodesets that are based on fedora-29
- This change introduces tempest-nfv and tempest-nfv-multinode jobs

The tempest-nfv job uses the qemu multi threaded tiny code
generator backend (MTTCG) to enable cpu pinning without kvm.
This requires a recent qemu and libvit 5.1.rc2 or newer.
libvirt 5.1.rc2 removes a hardcoded check that prevents cpu
pinning being enabled when qemu is used without kvm.
qemu automatically enables the MTTCG backed on supported
architechtures when a compatible cpu model is used.
To "force" the use of MTTCG we use cpu_mode=custom
and set the cpu_model to qemu64.

The tempest-nfv job operates by executing the standard
tempest test suite using nfv flavors to ensure that standard
operation function when using cpu pinning, hugepages, realtime
and an explicit numa topology of 1 numa node. addtionally
this tests emulator_threads isolate and share.

Change-Id: I8884a20d1cd81f5c43f43ed6575990110d75bc37

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 10:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'Use microversion in put allocations in test_report_client

In some places test_report_client uses a raw client.put when
writing allocations. This defaults to the latest microversion.
This means that if the allocations format changes in the latest
microversion in a patch in placement, the nova functional tests
fail.

In this change we pin the microversion to the minimum one providing
the features used in the PUT.

Change-Id: Ia0fee6bb931770792b552ae32ef31f0a4cc466ee
'}]
commit_message:
Use microversion in put allocations in test_report_client

In some places test_report_client uses a raw client.put when
writing allocations. This defaults to the latest microversion.
This means that if the allocations format changes in the latest
microversion in a patch in placement, the nova functional tests
fail.

In this change we pin the microversion to the minimum one providing
the features used in the PUT.

Change-Id: Ia0fee6bb931770792b552ae32ef31f0a4cc466ee

subject: Add variable causing error on rerun for redhat OS
messages:

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Iadbfcb0ab746ac0a64abc85ae7ea2f628405f6fb

Story: 2003487
Task: 24756

commit_message:
Do not perform the tenant stack limit check for admin user

Removing stack creation limit for admin since admin can view all stacks,
and stacks created by other tenants would have been counted in the limit
check.

Change-Id: Ie2e9251245e7e16309661154e17724e5984c21e6
Story: 2003487
Task: 24756

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I859b38b139a37cb092b5d6c11998b7400613c342
'}]
commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I859b38b139a37cb092b5d6c11998b7400613c342

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Iae3db530e906e36571951deb31f242b7e4fcb75d

subject: debian: update images to queens
messages:
[{'account_id': 26768, 'date': '2019-01-11 15:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-01-11 17:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(44 comments)

Sorry but I am unable to review the whole patch. Same mistakes all the time.

Please rebase it on top of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625298 one so you will get most of those python(3) differences sorted out and amount of changes you did will drop. Simple "Depends-on: CHANGEID-FROM-625298' will sort out dependency for zuul and merging.

You added a bunch of external repositories but are they available for architectures other than amd64? If not then add [arch=arm64] to each such line so aarch64 or ppc64le will be able to do builds. And handle packages where needed. I will do build of Debian/source images with your patch applied and can provide you build logs.

Wherever you split debian/ubuntu into parts remember to keep Debian first, Ubuntu second. Alphabetical order is required everywhere. In package/pip lists too.

Wherever you mention 'bug' link to bug report or add comment what exactly happen and why. Source based Queens/Rocky Debian images are used in production (on aarch64) so it works.

commit_message:
Save logs of previous restart of containers

We save logs of all containers running on our K8s, but sometimes those
containers are restarted. To increase debugging abilities this commit
makse sure to also save the logs of previous run of the service.

commit_message:
Readable heat-container-agent log

The output of heat-container-agent has become unreadable. This patch
aims to address this in order to make debugging easier.

Additionally, this patch also adds missing dependencies in the most
recent fedora:rawhide (32) image.

Task: 36392
Story: 2006463

Change-Id: I54180b96357f6fa6d4044d818740ae70e036e435

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 17:37:58.000000000', 'message': '[nova] Fix service catalog lookup of Neutron endpoint

nova.conf currently uses the [neutron] "url" parameter which has been
deprecated since 17.0.0. In multi-region environments this can
cause Nova to look up the Neutron endpoint for a different region.
Remove this parameter and set region_name and
valid_interfaces to allow the correct lookup to be performed.

Change-Id: I1bbc73728439a460447bc8edd264f9f2d3c814e0
Closes-Bug: #1836952
'}]
commit_message:
[nova] Fix service catalog lookup of Neutron endpoint

nova.conf currently uses the [neutron] "url" parameter which has been
deprecated since 17.0.0. In multi-region environments this can
cause Nova to look up the Neutron endpoint for a different region.
Remove this parameter and set region_name and
valid_interfaces to allow the correct lookup to be performed.

Change-Id: I1bbc73728439a460447bc8edd264f9f2d3c814e0
Closes-Bug: #1836952

commit_message:
Trivial: improve failover logging

We log a warning when detecting a failover for which the destination
host matches the one that's already set in the Nova db. Some times
this means that instance bounced between hosts but most of the times
this is just a migration initiated by Nova, which already updated
the DB.

While at it, when the driver initializes, we'll log the list of
detected failovers before asynchronously handling them.

Change-Id: I808c8cb63ac0011be8d6824a2f8e9292fe39004f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-03 08:58:52.000000000', 'message': 'Initialize coordination during driver init

At the moment, the "init_host" method initializes the distributed
lock mechanism, yet the driver may try to use distributed locks
before that.

For example, the method that reclaims failed over instances is
called by the driver init method, before init_host. While we
can fix this particular call, it's safer that we initialize the
lock mechanism as early as possible.

Change-Id: If361c0f754d3680726762e3126286227bea6f3f3
Related-Bug: #1841777
'}, {'created': '2019-09-03 11:51:06.000000000', 'message': 'Initialize coordination during driver init

lock mechanism, yet the driver may try to use distributed locks
before that.

For example, the method that reclaims failed over instances is
called by the driver init method, before init_host. While we
can fix this particular call, it's safer that we initialize the
lock mechanism as early as possible.

Change-Id: If361c0f754d3680726762e3126286227bea6f3f3
Related-Bug: #1841777
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize coordination during driver init

At the moment, the "init_host" method initializes the distributed
lock mechanism, yet the driver may try to use distributed locks
before that.

For example, the method that reclaims failed over instances is
called by the driver init method, before init_host. While we
can fix this particular call, it's safer that we initialize the
lock mechanism as early as possible.

Change-Id: If361c0f754d3680726762e3126286227bea6f3f3
Related-Bug: #1841777

commit_message:
Handle instances failed over while nova was down

At the moment, the driver won't handle instances that were failed
over while the service was down. This is due to a regression,
the method doing this isn't called properly.

Closes-Bug: #1841777

Change-Id: I4ecf916b1d3323077646a38b9491785accb3c87c

messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-28 10:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-08-28 13:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-09-03 11:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2019-09-04 12:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-09-05 09:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 16c4c3dee6037d9ee367e0c96707fa99363773fe'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 10:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Recreate ports for failed over instances

OVS ports can become invalid after the instances are failed over.
If an instance lands back on the initial host and the ports are
not cleaned up, it will be left with those stale ports.

This change adds a config option, allowing those ports to be recreated.
It will be enabled by default. Deployers may consider disabling it
if the remaining ports are cleaned up when rebooting nodes or if the
network backend is not affected by this issue.

Change-Id: I58aba53b7bc0a5e8954cf31adac6e7e106944b7e
'}, {'created': '2019-08-28 13:08:53.000000000', 'message': 'Recreate ports for failed over instances

OVS ports can become invalid after the instances are failed over.
If an instance lands back on the initial host and the ports are
not cleaned up, it will be left with those stale ports.

This change adds a config option, allowing those ports to be recreated.
It will be enabled by default. Deployers may consider disabling it
if the remaining ports are cleaned up when rebooting nodes or if the
network backend is not affected by this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1841778

Change-Id: I58aba53b7bc0a5e8954cf31adac6e7e106944b7e
'}, {'created': '2019-09-03 11:51:06.000000000', 'message': 'Recreate ports for failed over instances

OVS ports can become invalid after the instances are failed over.
If an instance lands back on the initial host and the ports are
not cleaned up, it will be left with those stale ports.

This change adds a config option, allowing those ports to be recreated.
It will be enabled by default. Deployers may consider disabling it
if the remaining ports are cleaned up when rebooting nodes or if the
network backend is not affected by this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1841778

Change-Id: I58aba53b7bc0a5e8954cf31adac6e7e106944b7e
'}]
commit_message:
Recreate ports for failed over instances

OVS ports can become invalid after the instances are failed over.
If an instance lands back on the initial host and the ports are
not cleaned up, it will be left with those stale ports.

This change adds a config option, allowing those ports to be recreated.
It will be enabled by default. Deployers may consider disabling it
if the remaining ports are cleaned up when rebooting nodes or if the
network backend is not affected by this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1841778

Change-Id: I58aba53b7bc0a5e8954cf31adac6e7e106944b7e

commit_message:
Avoid error state for recovered instances after failed migrations

Most users expect that if a live migration fails but the instance
is fully recovered, it shouldn't enter 'error' state. Setting
the migration status to 'error' should be enough. This simplifies
debugging, making it clear that the instance dosn't have to be
manually recovered.

This patch changed this behavior, indirectly affecting the Hyper-V
driver: Idfdce9e7dd8106af01db0358ada15737cb846395

We'll stop propagating exceptions when managing to recover the
instance, which matches the reference driver (libvirt) behavior.

Change-Id: I4b667c06e008b03457d35ce9c920b916d21c255f
Closes-Bug: 1841411

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I65a2216a370204ab865f0d9432a9f5327920a777

subject: Allow creating ICMPV6 rules
messages: [{'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-08-26 21:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-03 14:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-09-04 17:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27822, 'date': '2019-09-05 01:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-09-05 08:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 21:16:59.000000000', 'message': "Allow creating ICMPV6 rules

Right now, even if we specify a ::/0 (or other IPv6) CIDR in an
ICMP rule, Horizon sets 'icmp' as the ip_protocol of that rule but
neutron expects 'ipv6-icmp' which is the right ip_protocol for ICMPv6.
This results in that rule never matching anything.

This change makes Horizon set the ip_protocol to ipv6-icmp when
the CIDR is an IPv6 one, and icmp when it's IPv4.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1f68e1e5a3e073e38ac258de5ed9c43f8acb04e9
Closes-Bug: #1652619
(cherry picked from commit d5dcf1be93d9bb26bda7b375e41f03dd297888bb)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow creating ICMPV6 rules

Right now, even if we specify a ::/0 (or other IPv6) CIDR in an
ICMP rule, Horizon sets 'icmp' as the ip_protocol of that rule but
neutron expects 'ipv6-icmp' which is the right ip_protocol for ICMPv6.
This results in that rule never matching anything.

This change makes Horizon set the ip_protocol to ipv6-icmp when
the CIDR is an IPv6 one, and icmp when it's IPv4.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1f68e1e5a3e073e38ac258de5ed9c43f8acb04e9
Closes-Bug: #1652619
(cherry picked from commit d5dcf1be93d9bb26bda7b375e41f03dd297888bb)

[{'created': '2019-09-04 09:02:52.000000000', 'message': 'Disable link check in "test_get_devices_info_veth_different_namespaces"

If two veth pairs are in different namespaces, the interface link
(namespace interface index) should be empty because this interface
index do not refer to the same namespace.

The Pyroute interface index table is unique per namespace.

Change-Id: Id161423737189bf822716be953c0db9c1f09589d
Related-Bug: #1842482

commit_message:
Veth pair "IFLA_LINK" populated since kernel 4.15.0-60-generic

Since kernel_version=4.15.0-60-generic, "iproute2" provides the veth
pair index, even if the pair interface is in other namespace. In
previous versions, the parameter 'IFLA_LINK' was not present. We need
to handle both cases

Change-Id: Id161423737189bf822716be953c0db9c1f09589d
Closes-Bug: #1842482

commit_message:
Remove Sheepdog tests from zuul config

This was not working in Stein either. Backporting to allow us to
eventually remove the job definition in openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: I4ca37dc248ac5defbc988507379288299b19a6d7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked

commit_message:
Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

Change-Id: I8c509d411b8fdf7e65622f1fbb2095fe9c3b98b5
Closes-Bug: #1841068
(cherry picked from commit d9c1cb6aa1c6979c8a80a7d9b95f49e61e964b3a)

Improve logging for discovered container names

Provide more details for the fixed/service and discovered
containers (delegates).

Change-Id: I7b7d340a42d8d243fa764d6102b06d241b4ead98

config for RHEL8.  This properly adds it to match
CentOS jobs.
