commit_message:
Image deletion returns 500 if 'file' store is not enabled

When image import fails during image is uploading from staging area,
image remains in uploading state and data remains in staging area. In
this scenario if 'file' store is not enabled then while deleting the
image glance-api returns 500 status code with error 'file' scheme is
Unknwon.

Used os module to unlink the file present in staging area explicitly to
delete the data from staging area.

Change-Id: I57dcd6b18b0039e824e8adbe77de59079360a34f
Closes-Bug: #1836140
(cherry picked from commit 7f74a92338894d01feebf706663b1b5a10d99ece)

commit_message:
Add conditional field matching

Adds the ability to conditionally match sushy fields against
received JSON object.

The conditional matching is performed by a user-supplied callable
which gets the key to consider (along with the value and potentially
other details) and should indicate the the caller if the match
occurred.

The motivation behind this change is to accommodate malformed Redfish
resource properties as observed in the OEM wilderness.

Change-Id: I9da9a83b72b670e15b53ef906f186473340c0935

commit_message:
Allocations leaked during migration rollback

Allocations committed against the destination host are not reverted
during live migration rollbacks. The reason is that we're not passing
the migrate data object properly.

At some point, the rollback callback signature has changed. We picked
it up but only for the main (non-cluster) driver:
I5f247d733642464f4ede0430d4dfc8a27a02e7fd

This change addresses the cluster driver as well.

Change-Id: I8c509d411b8fdf7e65622f1fbb2095fe9c3b98b5
Closes-Bug: #1841068

commit_message:
re-calculate provider mapping during migration

Nova intentionally does not persist the resoruce request of the neturon
ports. Therefore during migration nova needs to query neturon about the
resource requests to include them to the allocation_candidates query
sent to placement during scheduling. Also when the allocation is made by
the scheduler nova needs to re-calculate request group - resource
provider mapping. A subsequent patch will use this mapping to update the
binding profile when the port is bound to the destination host of the
migration.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports

Change-Id: I8e5a0480c81ba548bc1f50a8098eabac52b11453

Had to add explicit bind-mounts so that container-puppet generates a TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH for paunch.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-09-03 21:19:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Workflow

Ok tested locally on a 3-node overcloud and on a composable HA (3 db, 3 rabbits, 3 API) overcloud.
The restart seems to work fine both for stack update and minor update.

Tests done on the mysql service in the composable HA env:

1. First deploy, restart_bundle doesn't trigger resource restart yet because it doesn't exist at the time mysql_restart_bundle is first run

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 16:56:53.000000000', 'message': "HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629

commit_message:
HA: fix <service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow

For each HA service we have a paunch container <service>_restart_bundle
which is started by paunch whenever config files changes during stack
deploy/update. This container runs a pcs command on a single node to
restart all the service's containers (e.g. all galera on all controllers).
By design, when it is run, configs have already been regenerated by the
deploy tasks on all nodes.

For minor updates, the workflow runs differently: all the steps of the
deploy tasks are run one node after the other, so when
<service>_restart_bundle is called, there is no guarantee that the
service's configs have been regenerated on all the nodes yet.

To fix the wrong restart behaviour, only restart local containers when
running during a minor update. And run once per node. When the minor
update workflow calls <service>_restart_container, we still have the
guarantee that the config files are already regenerated locally.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45
Closes-Bug: #1841629

commit_message:
telemetry-tempest-plugin: Switch to python3 only

There is only a python3 tempest version so it doesn't make sense to
have py2 and py3 for the telemetry plugin.
Also fix the Requires.

Change-Id: I57e4d21ab9a14d1733720e940f2ea8d49bd5c1dd

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-28 13:10:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

I think the current name might be okay, because the aggregates that are being manipulated are the ones that originated in nova and are proxied (by nova) to placement, automatically.

But, yes it is a bit weird. I'm not really sure what the best solution is. Of course whatever we choose we need to make sure the docs make it clear what's happening.

Will take off my vote while this percolated."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-04-05 13:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'll jump in with the generic OSC way of looking at this...

The key here seems to be sorting out what users see as the command objects they are manipulating.  Is a resource provider aggregate a thing?  Is that the thing being manipulated here?

What I see is that resource providers have an aggregate attribute, set using 'resource provider create/set' commands.  I read Melanie's explanation as manipulating a set of resource providers filtered by an aggregate attribute value.  I don't recall that OSC has a lot of set commands using filters, but many list commands do have filters like this.  I believe users will make the connection if they behave the same.

My first cut at a command to set a ratio on the set of resource providers with a specific aggregate attribute value is:

  resource provider set --resource <resource-class>=<ratio> [--aggregate] <id>

where <id> is a resource provider uuid or when --aggregate is present is an aggregate uuid.  (Bonus points for efficiently auto-detecting the <id> value without using the --aggregate option)

If resource provider aggregates were something users created and deleted I would be more inclined to also have set/unset commands for them.  Note that is independent of if they exist as a thing in the database, it is all about what the users mental model looks like."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-05 14:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I'll jump in with the generic OSC way of looking at this...

Sweet, glad to have your advice here.

 > The key here seems to be sorting out what users see as the command
 > objects they are manipulating.  Is a resource provider aggregate a
 > thing?  Is that the thing being manipulated here?
 
A resource provider aggregate is a thing [1], but it is not the thing being manipulated here.

 > What I see is that resource providers have an aggregate attribute,
 > set using 'resource provider create/set' commands.  I read
 > Melanie's explanation as manipulating a set of resource providers
 > filtered by an aggregate attribute value.  I don't recall that OSC
 > has a lot of set commands using filters, but many list commands do
 > have filters like this.  I believe users will make the connection
 > if they behave the same.

Correct, this batch command essentially does a 'resource provider set' per resource provider filtered on aggregate UUID.

 > My first cut at a command to set a ratio on the set of resource
 > providers with a specific aggregate attribute value is:
 > 
 > resource provider set --resource <resource-class>=<ratio>
 > [--aggregate] <id>
 > 
 > where <id> is a resource provider uuid or when --aggregate is
 > present is an aggregate uuid.  (Bonus points for efficiently
 > auto-detecting the <id> value without using the --aggregate option)

I really like this idea. And I think having --aggregate be explicit is nice for clarity, at least IMHO.

 > If resource provider aggregates were something users created and
 > deleted I would be more inclined to also have set/unset commands
 > for them.  Note that is independent of if they exist as a thing in
 > the database, it is all about what the users mental model looks
 > like.

We actually already do have 'resource provider set' commands [2], so I think your idea fits in nicely.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html#resource-provider-aggregate-set
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html#resource-provider-set"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-05 15:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think I'm gonna try respinning with Dean's idea and see what folks think. Since what I have here isn't so well loved anyway."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-05 16:28:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> We actually already do have 'resource provider set' commands [2],
 > so I think your idea fits in nicely.
 > 
 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html#resource-provider-aggregate-set
 > [2] https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html#resource-provider-set

Correction: this will go under 'resource provider inventory set' [3] rather than 'resource provider set'. Because the batch command does 'resource provider inventory set' underneath.

[3] https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html#resource-provider-inventory-set"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-06 01:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-06 01:44:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-04-06 02:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

It may no longer be backward-compatible but I would suggest making the entire replacement thing not work that way.  We do that in a number of other places even though it may take an extra round-trip or two so the user only has to explicitly list the changes.  When you do want the effect of replacement we usually add a --no-XXXX option that can be used to clear the set first.

I understand if you wish to keep the CLI close to the REST API but for much of OSC we do not do that...'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-06 02:06:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> It may no longer be backward-compatible but I would suggest making
 > the entire replacement thing not work that way.  We do that in a
 > number of other places even though it may take an extra round-trip
 > or two so the user only has to explicitly list the changes.  When
 > you do want the effect of replacement we usually add a --no-XXXX
 > option that can be used to clear the set first.
 > 
 > I understand if you wish to keep the CLI close to the REST API but
 > for much of OSC we do not do that...

Yeah, I can see your point. I was indeed worried about the backward compatibility of changing the way 'set' works entirely. I was thinking more along the lines of adding 'update' and deprecating 'set' if that would be cool with folks. If everyone would prefer I make these changes to the 'set' command, I just need some guidance on how to signal the change (major version bump along with the release note?). Speaking of which, I need a release note."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-12 17:01:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

FWIW, I'm ready to make changes to this but looking for guidance about whether I should:

* Change the behavior of the 'set' command instead of adding the 'update' command and do a major version bump to break backward compat

* Leave this as-is and start the deprecation process for the 'set' command

* Add this behavior to the 'set' command in the form of an --amend option (based on Matt's last comment). Note that I would have to allow --aggregate iff --amend in this case.

Anyone have opinions about which way to go?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> FWIW, I'm ready to make changes to this but looking for guidance
 > about whether I should:

I'll put my preferences in, but they're just that:

 > * Change the behavior of the 'set' command instead of adding the
 > 'update' command and do a major version bump to break backward
 > compat

Let's not do this, as it changes the meaning of "set" which we've established to mean something already and even if it we signal that change of meaning with a major version bump it's still... weird

 > * Leave this as-is and start the deprecation process for the 'set'
 > command

Same as above. Even if we deprecate we still end up break extant code if that code isn't paying sufficient attention to pin their requirements (which I think plenty of things which use a command line client are likely to do).

 > * Add this behavior to the 'set' command in the form of an --amend
 > option (based on Matt's last comment). Note that I would have to
 > allow --aggregate iff --amend in this case.

So I would say, of the three, this is perhaps best?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-15 20:35:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Thanks for responding. :) I guess really there's a fourth option, which is leave this patch as-is. I do have some concern about potential confusion if we have 'set' and 'update' coexisting though."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-04-16 19:57:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Melanie's first option is the OSC-like way of handling it and what I would suggest to be consistent.  But then again I can only say consistent with the commands in the OSC repo, plenty of other plugins have done differently already..."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-16 20:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Melanie's first option is the OSC-like way of handling it and what
 > I would suggest to be consistent.  But then again I can only say
 > consistent with the commands in the OSC repo, plenty of other
 > plugins have done differently already...

I think ordinarily we'd go with option 1 but I now realize that Chris's point was that all of the _other_ osc-placement 'set' commands [1] have an established meaning and if we were to change this one, it would become inconsistent with the others. We'd have to change them all in one go to make it less weird. And..., I must admit I don't have the energy at the moment to want to change them all in one go. It would be a large undertaking.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/osc-placement/latest/cli/index.html"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-30 18:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-07-30 19:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 00:13:11.000000000', 'message': "Add 'aggregate allocation ratio set' batch command

This adds a batch command which takes an aggregate UUID and a
repeatable --resource <resource class>=<ratio> option and will set the
allocation ratios for the specified resources for each resource
provider that is a member of the specified aggregate.

This command is an attempt to give operators a tool to make setting
overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis easier, after the
functionality from the old Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler
filters was removed back in Ocata [1].

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae

"}, {'created': '2019-04-06 01:36:54.000000000', 'message': "Add 'resource provider inventory update' command

This adds a new 'update' command which can update resource provider
inventory without requiring the user to pass a full replacement for
inventory like the 'set' command requires. It does a GET for existing
inventory, applies user provided updates, and does a PUT of the updated
inventory.

The command also has the ability to batch inventory updates for all
resource providers that are members of a specified --aggregate. And it
has a --dry-run option to preview changes before effecting them.

The main motivation for this command is to give operators a tool to
make setting overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis
easier, after the functionality from the old
Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters was removed back in
Ocata [1].

Because the command is quite generic, operators can also use it to do
any inventory update without having to do the GET, update, PUT,
manually and batch any update for all resource provider members of an
aggregate.

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae
"}, {'created': '2019-07-30 18:37:45.000000000', 'message': "Add --amend option to 'resource provider inventory set'

The ability to batch inventory updates for all resource providers that
are members of an aggregate is also added via a new '--aggregate'
option. The ability to preview changes before effecting them is also

commit_message:
Add --aggregate option to 'resource provider inventory set'

This adds a new '--aggregate' option which can set resource provider
inventory for all resource providers that are members of the specified
aggregate.

The main motivation for this option is to give operators a tool to
make setting overcommit allocation ratios on a per-aggregate basis
easier, after the functionality from the old
Aggregate[Core|Ram|Disk]Filter scheduler filters was removed back in
Ocata [1].

[1]
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126283.html

Story: 2006318
Task: 36189

Change-Id: Ib0cbb58d0adbbcfe83ee48d2ff6c9af1a516a7ae

subject: Release python-zunclient 3.5.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-01 04:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-01 22:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-02 09:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Commit message does not match version... which is right?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-02 13:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-02 13:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-03 19:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The one commit included in this doesn't look like it's backwards incompatible. Are you sure you want a major version release for this? Seems like 3.5.0 would more accurately reflect what's included."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-04 01:03:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The one commit included in this doesn't look like it's backwards
 > incompatible. Are you sure you want a major version release for
 > this? Seems like 3.5.0 would more accurately reflect what's
 > included.

The planned release for Zun is 4.0.0 for train. I want to make the python-zunclient release as 4.0.0 as well so it matches. However, I can change it back to 3.5.0 if you want."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-04 01:21:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I generally recommend against artificially syncing separate deliverable versions. Inevitably you will end up with the need to do a major version bump of the client without the server and you'll be out of sync again."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-04 04:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-09-04 04:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I generally recommend against artificially syncing separate
 > deliverable versions. Inevitably you will end up with the need to
 > do a major version bump of the client without the server and you'll
 > be out of sync again.

OK. Changed it to 3.5.0"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-04 09:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-04 12:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks!'}]

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: Ife8461f00ba2206d18ae45837bbc31d211e29841

LaTeX Error: Too deeply nested.' in this environment but suspect I may have inappropriate binary dependencies."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2019-08-29 20:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

According to [0], we shouldn't be creating a new tox env but a new CI job

"The doc gate job should run and produce PDFs for all projects, it should not depend on in-repository declarations of new dependencies or a new tox env."

Testing on Ubuntu Bionic, I had to install latexmk.

I got the following output

The LaTeX files are in doc/build/pdf.
Run 'make' in that directory to run these through (pdf)latex
(use `make latexpdf' here to do that automatically).
pdf-docs run-test: commands[1] | make -C doc/build/pdf
make: Entering directory '/opt/stack/manila/doc/build/pdf'
latexmk -pdf -dvi- -ps-  'manila.tex'
Latexmk: This is Latexmk, John Collins, 1 January 2015, version: 4.41.
Latexmk: applying rule 'pdflatex'...
Rule 'pdflatex': Rules & subrules not known to be previously run:
   pdflatex
Rule 'pdflatex': The following rules & subrules became out-of-date:
      'pdflatex'
------------
Run number 1 of rule 'pdflatex'
------------
------------
Running 'xelatex   -recorder  "manila.tex"'
------------
sh: 1: xelatex: not found
Latexmk: Errors, so I did not complete making targets
Collected error summary (may duplicate other messages):
  pdflatex: (Pdf)LaTeX failed to generate the expected log file 'manila.log'
Latexmk: Did not finish processing file 'manila.tex':
   (Pdf)LaTeX failed to generate the expected log file 'manila.log'
Latexmk: Use the -f option to force complete processing,
 unless error was exceeding maximum runs of latex/pdflatex.
Makefile:33: recipe for target 'manila.pdf' failed
make: *** [manila.pdf] Error 12
make: Leaving directory '/opt/stack/manila/doc/build/pdf''}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2019-08-29 21:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Had to install texlive-xetex as well, now it works and the docs look great.

So my only concern now is the comment about tox envs in the spec'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-08-30 07:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Nice, and thanks!
 > 
 > Do you know if we're also supposed to generate pdf under the actual
 > docs target?

You mean instead of the new pdf-docs target? I don't know. I was following https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal and looked at other patches from the same topic.


 > Also, what about bindep updates?  I had to add a bunch to texlive
 > stuff when attempting to generate pdf on Fedora 30.

There is eg. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667345/6/bindep.txt which adds bindep entries for tex. I would say we can add the bindeps later when the process has settled. I still hope that theses deps can be handled in a central place. Having them in every repo is error prone.
 > With your
 > patch I am getting '! LaTeX Error: Too deeply nested.' in this
 > environment but suspect I may have inappropriate binary
 > dependencies.

Hm. I had in the beginning but it works now with the current patchset."}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-08-30 07:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> According to [0], we shouldn't be creating a new tox env but a new
 > CI job
 > 
 > "The doc gate job should run and produce PDFs for all projects, it
 > should not depend on in-repository declarations of new dependencies
 > or a new tox env."
 
Yeah. I was following https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal which has the same statement but some lines later a definition of a new tox target. Confusing...'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-08-30 12:37:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

OK, we can do the bindep as followup or, preferably, centrally rather than in the project.  Let's find out whether to keep the separate tox target (as in the example) or use the docs target (as documented) before merging.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2019-08-30 12:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks for addressing comments Thomas, looks good!'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-09-02 07:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> OK, we can do the bindep as followup or, preferably, centrally
 > rather than in the project.  Let's find out whether to keep the
 > separate tox target (as in the example) or use the docs target (as
 > documented) before merging.

I sent a mail to the list to ask about the tox addition: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-September/008980.html"}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-09-02 07:32:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > OK, we can do the bindep as followup or, preferably, centrally
 > > rather than in the project.  Let's find out whether to keep the
 > > separate tox target (as in the example) or use the docs target
 > (as
 > > documented) before merging.
 >

 > http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-September/008980.html

According to the answer - a new tox env is needed.

@Tom, I guess you can change your +1 to a +2 then :)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-09-02 08:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Regarding package dependencies for PDF build, see "To test locally" in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal . revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 12:40:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add PDF documentation build

This commit adds a new tox target to build PDF documentation.
It's a community goal[0] to have PDF docs available.

Also some minor fixes are needed for PDF:
- Only show genindex and search for HTML. Theses elements do not make
sense within PDF documents
- Do not include full config sample files. This will not work and
produces a "Dimension too large" error during the latex run.

[0]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: I66b8c47d599c97e66c2ca76faa66204d5e7c9c3b
'}]
commit_message:
Add PDF documentation build

This commit adds a new tox target to build PDF documentation.
It's a community goal[0] to have PDF docs available.

Also some minor fixes are needed for PDF:
- Only show genindex and search for HTML. Theses elements do not make
sense within PDF documents
- Do not include full config sample files. This will not work and
produces a "Dimension too large" error during the latex run.

[0]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: I66b8c47d599c97e66c2ca76faa66204d5e7c9c3b

commit_message:
Update driver interface

spawn() now accepts the "power_on" flag, allowing instances to be
created without being turned on. This is part of the cross-cell
migration workflow.

Change-Id: Ifd18a69f476ebbfb4ee6ec34abb03da0d2e30ceb

messages:
[{'account_id': 30883, 'date': '2019-08-27 02:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-27 02:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2019-09-04 12:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-11 00:00:13.000000000', 'message': "Fixes compatibility with python34

The xml package changed ElementTree with python 3.x to return a
bytestring when calling 'tostring' method as the default behavior.
Libvirt complains when trying to create the domain that it is expecting
a string.  This patch fixes the issue by specifying the encoding type as
unicode.  This should work for python 2.x and python 3.x.

Change-Id: I7f517b5f44f57a644ed5bc44097e3230311f980b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes compatibility with python34

The xml package changed ElementTree with python 3.x to return a
bytestring when calling 'tostring' method as the default behavior.
Libvirt complains when trying to create the domain that it is expecting
a string.  This patch fixes the issue by specifying the encoding type as
unicode.  This should work for python 2.x and python 3.x.

Change-Id: I7f517b5f44f57a644ed5bc44097e3230311f980b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-09-04 04:46:35.000000000', 'message': 'Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I98d52f3b259cfffeb0e8ec996279ad4ff782276d
'}]
commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I98d52f3b259cfffeb0e8ec996279ad4ff782276d

commit_message:
Add periodic logs during database mechanism

This patch will help operator and developer who can
follow actions during checking server status and
service status of creating/deleting mechanism.

Change-Id: I479628d66a9016750a21d9846358406e097525e5

commit_message:
Use SDK for setting instance id

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the _set_instance_id function.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I95f3414d29a5ff5cc49994bac1cda917edc4f292

This patch set skips the error when NPs are enabled and a pod that
has not yet been annotated by kuryr is deleted (for instance a pod
in pending status). The information about the IP is found on the
annotations and as that is not already there no rules would have

commit_message:
Skipping sg rule deletion for pods without annotations

This patch set skips the error when NPs are enabled and a pod that
has not yet been annotated by kuryr is deleted (for instance a pod
in pending status). The information about the IP is found on the
annotations and as that is not already there no rules would have
been created. Thus no need to remove them.

Change-Id: I850dc2d66fac2d7b44267382062093b19e5cd442
Closes-Bug: 1842099

commit_message:
Extract SEV-specific bits on host detection

Extract reducedPhysBits and cbitpos when detecting that host is
SEV-enabled.

These parameters will later be used to configure the guest.
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#sev-launch-time-configuration

Change-Id: I1d9308147a389fc94b7e872f9bd0621bdb25b193
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
Added information how to use JsonFilter

Creating a query hint to use JsonFilter that will choose
required backed to create a volume was complicated.
Added description how to use that will be helpful for others.

Change-Id: If04f037cf55b5b9d116927aa4b23a9c42d7b53e6
Co-authored-by: Bartosz Rabiega <bartosz.rabiega@corp.ovh.com>

commit_message:
Use SDK for validating instance and node

We would like nova not to use ironicclient, but instead to invoke the
ironic API directly through an openstacksdk connection.

The parent commits set up the framework, and this commit uses it
for the instance_exists function.

Blueprint: openstacksdk-in-nova
Change-Id: I764b0086d0bf39d4ca8cb308696169282b12b42b

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-02-12 16:42:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Some good stuff here but I'm reasonably confident that it will need a bit of rework to avoid introducing any operational logic into config.py.  I think we'll instead want to add logic to driver.py in order to make the decisions which harness this support code in order to generate the necessary tweaks to the XML required for SEV support.  

However since I'm new to this code base, the nova experts can confirm or deny my analysis."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-02-12 19:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 12:10:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add configs for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires to set several attributes to enable it:

 - launchSecurity
 - memtune with hard_limit

In addition to that, it requires to enable iommu driver for all virtio
devices, even if guest or host have no iommu device.

Add a class to create required elements and modify existing ones for SEV.

Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442
'}, {'created': '2019-02-12 15:02:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add configs for AMD SEV

In addition to that, it requires to enable iommu driver for all virtio

'}, {'created': '2019-05-17 18:31:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add <launchSecurity> element to libvirt guest XML for AMD SEV

AMD SEV requires the <launchSecurity> element in the libvirt guest XML
to enable it.  So add a LibvirtConfigGuestSEVLaunchSecurity class to
create the required element, and modify LibvirtConfigGuest to use it.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442
'}, {'created': '2019-05-24 23:49:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add <launchSecurity> element to libvirt guest XML for AMD SEV

'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'message': "Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to AMD SEV guest configs

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV, so add the required config class
for it.  For now the class just describes the new element, it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

commit_message:
Add <launchSecurity> and <driver iommu='on' /> to config.py

<launchSecurity> enables use of SEV, so add the required config class
for it.  For now the class just describes the new element; it will be
used in further commits.

Furthermore, AMD SEV requires enabling DMA APIs for virtio devices
via <driver iommu='on' />:

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#proposed-change

So also add the necessary bits for that to domain configuration.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ia78458ac698f66d297cb91bcab663fcf123c5442

commit_message:
Pass Domain Name to dhcp options

On subnet create dns_options are passed to OVN.
This patch adds missing domain_name field, which
is needed to support InternalDNS functionality.

Change-Id: I01e95ceb10bd6b4e0d9562c9a2abbefa85cdf1d7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-10 18:36:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new hw:mem_encryption extra spec parameter, and a new
hw_mem_encryption image property, which indicate that any guest booted
with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively needs to
be booted with its memory hardware encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the parameter and property into a
resource request for one slot of the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory
provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
'}, {'created': '2019-06-11 15:45:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the parameter and property into a
resource request for one slot of the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory
provided by Ib1304e65f1.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a RequestFilterFailed exception.

Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7
'}, {'created': '2019-06-17 15:13:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the
MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT inventory provided by Ib1304e65f1.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requesters() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requesters(), and then caught and re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I8c63b5cc5ad97ce831adb2eb96a995ebc798ecb7

'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit Ib1304e65f1.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified, and they contradict each other, then log an error and raise
a new generic FlavorImageConflict exception, which can also be useful
in the future for handling other similar conflicts.  In this
particular use case, FlavorImageConflict is raised by
mem_encryption_requested(), and then if caught during the request
filter phase is re-raised as a RequestFilterFailed exception, or if
caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 13:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during the request filter phase is re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception, or if caught during API call
validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest

needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during the request filter phase is re-raised as a
RequestFilterFailed exception, or if caught during API call
validation, it's re-raised as HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

commit_message:
Add extra spec parameter and image property for memory encryption

Add a new "hw:mem_encryption" extra spec parameter, and a new
"hw_mem_encryption" image property, which indicate that any guest
booted with that extra spec parameter or image property respectively
needs to be booted with its memory hardware-encrypted.

This is achieved by converting the requirement stated in the extra
spec parameter and/or image property into an additional extra spec
parameter which requests resources for one slot of the inventory of
the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class (introduced in
os-resource-classes 0.4.0).  The inventory will be provided by the
follow-up commit I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d.

Since future commits adding support for SEV to guest XML config will
also need to know at launch-time whether memory encryption has been
requested, add a reusable mem_encryption_requested() function to the
nova.virt.hardware library for detecting which of the extra spec /
image property (if either) have requested encrypted memory.

If both the extra spec parameter and the image property are explicitly
specified and they contradict each other, or if either request memory
encryption but the image does not have hw_firmware_type set to UEFI,
then log an error and raise a new generic FlavorImageConflict
exception.  This exception can also be useful in the future for
handling other similar conflicts.  In this particular use case,
FlavorImageConflict is raised by mem_encryption_requested(), and then
if caught during API call validation, it's re-raised as
HTTPBadRequest.

In order to test this code, we need to construct various ImageMeta
objects containing fake data and a ImageMetaProps instance for each.
This is a slightly fiddly task which future patches in the SEV series
will also need to perform, so add a helper to nova.tests.unit.image.fake
for this.

messages: [{'account_id': 2062, 'date': '2019-09-04 10:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2019-09-04 10:57:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 10:32:49.000000000', 'message': 'neutron-tempest-plugin: Switch to python3

- Also drop the doc package. There is no useful doc to build.

commit_message:
neutron-tempest-plugin: Switch to python3

- Also drop the doc package. There is no useful doc to build.

Change-Id: I8fde07b95c84bd48ca858c5993f9e5a2161c716a

(23 comments)

Hard -1 for:
- not using os-resource-classes
- at least one definite syntactic error [1] - which would be caught by zuul except for...
- a complete lack of testing for anything touched by this patch (and plenty of stuff not touched by it).

The other things noted inline (excessive complexity of the ReportClient due to blind copying of Nova code) should also certainly be addressed. You could conceivably do that in subsequent change sets, except that would mean you either throw away much of the test code you write here, or defer that testing entirely. So IMO it would be best to do it all here.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659233/8/cyborg/conductor/manager.py@401'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-26 18:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 08:13:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Placement report

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d
'}, {'created': '2019-07-03 10:31:56.000000000', 'message': 'Placement report

1. Create resource provider, resource class, traits.
2. Nested resource provider is supported in this patch.
3. According to the comments and reply in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626057/10/cyborg/common/placement_client.py,
we should make a class to invoke Placement API. This has also been done in
this patch.
4. More info for driver developer, each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d
'}, {'created': '2019-07-04 09:50:17.000000000', 'message': 'Placement report

1. Create resource provider, resource class, traits.
2. Nested resource provider is supported in this patch.
3. According to the comments and reply in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626057/10/cyborg/common/placement_client.py,
we should make a class to invoke Placement API. This has also been done in
this patch.
4. Convert cyborg/objects/driver_objects/driver_device.py file type from dos to
unix, to avoid ^M at the end of each line.
4. More info for driver developers:  each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d

commit_message:
Placement report

1. Create resource provider, resource class, traits.
2. Nested resource provider is supported in this patch.
3. According to the comments and reply in:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626057/10/cyborg/common/placement_client.py,
we should make a class to invoke Placement API. This has also been done in
this patch.
4. Convert cyborg/objects/driver_objects/driver_device.py file type from dos to
unix, to avoid ^M at the end of each line.
5. Get rid of legacy: ProviderTree class.
6. More info for driver developers:  each driver should report resource class
and traits in driver_attribute field in order that cyborg-conductor can parse
it and report to placement.
7. update deployable rp_uuid field after getting rp_uuid from placement.

Change-Id: Ib8f682255d2ae60eb615c90de0a0f7c83d1af54d

commit_message:
Add disk format content from Image Guide

The container_format and disk_format identifiers and their
descriptions are being maintained in the Glance docs.  Move some
useful content on this topic over from the Image Guide before
deleting it over there so it's only being maintained in one
location.

Change-Id: Ifa8de9d3a3a2aa78ee305aaebb23cd982b02dd91
Partial-bug: #1842343

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 12:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use net_default_mac in ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Upstream ironic went from $net_default_ip to $net_default_mac in
ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt with
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/578959/

This commit makes the same change for
ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Using $net_default_ip breaks ironic standalone deployments with
[dhcp]dhcp_provider = none

Change-Id: I2ca9a66d2bdb0aab5cd9936c8be8206e6ade3bd5
Closes-Bug: 1842078
(cherry picked from commit 870cb1beb229d6f856da4c974ca7e73d3d89d56d)
'}]
commit_message:
Use net_default_mac in ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Upstream ironic went from $net_default_ip to $net_default_mac in
ironic/drivers/modules/master_grub_cfg.txt with
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/578959/

This commit makes the same change for
ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic_pxe_uefi.default.j2

Using $net_default_ip breaks ironic standalone deployments with
[dhcp]dhcp_provider = none

Change-Id: I2ca9a66d2bdb0aab5cd9936c8be8206e6ade3bd5
Closes-Bug: 1842078
(cherry picked from commit 870cb1beb229d6f856da4c974ca7e73d3d89d56d)

commit_message:
Remove pike multinode jobs

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678154/ creates the pike-eol
branch and it's time to say goodbye to pike jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678154/

Change-Id: I455928e4f9a554faec17bff18b8256f4a67172e7
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
